translated: arrogant due to his family, wealth, fame and strength, Shalya said this:

original: avamanyase māṃ gāndhāre dhruvaṃ māṃ pariśaṅkase
analyzed: avamanyase mām gāndhāre dhruvam mām pariśaṅkase
translated: O son of Gandhari, you certainly despise me, you certainly suspect me,

original: yan māṃ bravīṣi visrabdhaṃ sārathyaṃ kriyatām iti
analyzed: yat mām bravīṣi visrabdham sārathyam kriyatām iti
translated: since you confidently tell me, 'Be the charioteer.'

analyzed: asmattaḥ bhyadhikam karṇam manyamānaḥ praśaṃsasi
translated: Considering Karna superior to me, you praise him.

original: na cāhaṃ yudhi rādheyaṃ gaṇaye tulyam ātmanā
analyzed: na ca aham yudhi rādheyam gaṇaye tulyam ātmanā
translated: I do not consider Radha's son equal to myself in battle.

analyzed: ādiśyatām abhyadhikaḥ mama aṃśaḥ pṛthivīpate
translated: Appoint someone superior to me, O lord of the earth.

original: tam ahaṃ samare hatvā gamiṣyāmi yathāgatam
analyzed: tam aham samare hatvā gamiṣyāmi yathāgatam
translated: Having killed him in battle, I will go as I came.

original: atha vāpy eka evāhaṃ yotsyāmi kurunandana
analyzed: atha vā api ekaḥ eva aham yotsyāmi kuru nandana
translated: Or else, O descendant of the Kuru lineage, I will fight alone.

original: paśya vīryaṃ mamādya tvaṃ saṃgrāme dahato ripūn
analyzed: paśya vīryam mama adya tvam saṃgrāme dahataḥ ripūn
translated: See my prowess today as I burn the enemies in battle.

original: na cābhikāmān kauravya vidhāya hṛdaye pumān🔽asmadvidhaḥ pravarteta mā mā tvam atiśaṅkithāḥ
analyzed: na ca abhikāmān kauravya vidhāya hṛdaye pumān  asmadvidhaḥ pravarteta mā mā tvam atiśaṅkithāḥ
translated: Having made such a desire in my heart, a man like me would not act, O Kauravya. Do not doubt me too much.

original: yudhi cāpy avamāno me na kartavyaḥ kathaṃ cana🔽paśya hīmau mama bhujau vajrasaṃhananopamau
analyzed: yudhi ca api avamānaḥ me na kartavyaḥ katham cana  paśya hi imau mama bhujau vajra saṃhanana upamau
translated: And in battle, you should never show me disrespect.🔽Look at these two arms of mine, which are like the thunderbolt in hardness.

original: dhanuḥ paśya ca me citraṃ śarāṃś cāśīviṣopamān
analyzed: dhanuḥ paśya ca me citram śarān ca āśīviṣa upamān
translated: Look at my wonderful bow and arrows that are like venomous serpents.

original: rathaṃ paśya ca me kḷptaṃ sadaśvair vātavegitaiḥ
analyzed: ratham paśya ca me kḷptam sat aśvaiḥ vāta vegitaiḥ
translated: Look at my chariot that is equipped with swift horses that are as fast as the wind.

analyzed: gadām ca paśya gāndhāre hema paṭṭa vibhūṣitām
translated: And look at my mace, O son of Gandhari, which is adorned with golden plates.

original: dārayeyaṃ mahīṃ kruddho vikireyaṃ ca parvatān
analyzed: dārayeyam mahīm kruddhaḥ vikireyam ca parvatān
translated: In anger, I could cleave the earth and scatter the mountains.

original: śoṣayeyaṃ samudrāṃś ca tejasā svena pārthiva
analyzed: śoṣayeyam samudrān ca tejasā svena pārthiva
translated: I could dry up the oceans with my own energy, O king.

original: tan mām evaṃvidhaṃ jānan samartham arinigrahe
analyzed: tat mām evaṃvidham jānan samartham ari nigrahe
translated: Knowing me to be such, capable of restraining enemies,

analyzed: kasmāt yunakṣi sārathye nyūnasya ādhiratheḥ nṛpa
translated: why do you employ me as a charioteer, O king, for a lesser Adhiratha?

original: na cāpi mama rādheyaḥ kalām arhati ṣoḍaśīm
analyzed: na ca api mama rādheyaḥ kalām arhati ṣoḍaśīm
translated: Radheya does not deserve even a sixteenth part of me.

original: sakarṇā ye trayo lokāḥ sārjunāḥ sajanārdanāḥ
analyzed: sa karṇāḥ ye trayaḥ lokāḥ sa arjunāḥ sa janārdanāḥ
translated: If the three worlds with Karna, Arjuna and Janardana were bound,

original: nibaddhāṃs tān raṇe rājan na mucyeyaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: nibaddhān tān raṇe rājan na mucyeyam katham cana
translated: I would never release them in battle, O king.

original: tathāpi śaktaṃ kauravya vihāya hṛdayena mām
analyzed: tathā api śaktam kauravya vihāya hṛdayena mām
translated: Yet, O Kauravya, having disregarded me who am capable, with your heart,

original: na cāhaṃ prākṛtaḥ kaś cin na cāpy adhigataḥ svayam
analyzed: na ca aham prākṛtaḥ kaḥ cit na ca api adhigataḥ svayam
translated: I am not an ordinary person, nor have I been obtained by you.

original: ayaṃ cāpy avamāno me na kartavyaḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: ayam ca api avamānaḥ me na kartavyaḥ katham cana
translated: This insult of mine should never be done.

original: na nāma dhuri rājendra prayoktuṃ tvam ihārhasi
analyzed: na nāma dhuri rāja indra prayoktum tvam iha arhasi
translated: O lord of kings, you should not employ me in a burden like this.

original: na hi pāpīyasaḥ śreyān bhūtvā preṣyatvam utsahe🔽yo hy abhyupagataṃ prītyā garīyāṃsaṃ vaśe sthitam
analyzed: na hi pāpīyasaḥ śreyān bhūtvā preṣya tvam utsahe  yaḥ hi abhyupagatam prītyā garīyāṃsam vaśe sthitam
translated: I do not dare to be a servant to a worse person, having become a better one.🔽He who, having accepted a heavier person out of love, places a worse person in control,

original: vaśe pāpīyaso dhatte tat pāpam adharottaram
analyzed: vaśe pāpīyasaḥ dhatte tat pāpam adharottaram
translated: that sin is the worst.

original: brāhmaṇā brahmaṇā sṛṣṭā mukhāt kṣatram athorasaḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ brahmaṇā sṛṣṭāḥ mukhāt kṣatram atha urasaḥ
translated: The Brahmanas were created by Brahma from his mouth, and the Kshatriyas from his chest.

original: ūrubhyām asṛjad vaiśyāñ śūdrān padbhyām iti śrutiḥ
analyzed: ūrubhyām asṛjat vaiśyām śūdrān padbhyām iti śrutiḥ
translated: The Vaishyas were created from his thighs, and the Shudras from his feet, according to the scriptures.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ varṇa viśeṣāḥ ca pratiloma anuloma jāḥ
translated: From them, and from the intermixture of the castes, both in the natural and reverse order,

analyzed: atha anyonyasya saṃyogāt cāturvarṇyasya bhārata
translated: and from the union of the four varnas with each other, O Bharata,

analyzed: goptāraḥ saṃgrahītāraḥ dātāraḥ kṣatriyāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: the Kshatriyas are remembered as the protectors, the gatherers, and the givers.

analyzed: yājana adhyāpanaiḥ viprāḥ viśuddhaiḥ ca pratigrahaiḥ
translated: The Brahmanas, by officiating at sacrifices, by teaching, and by pure gifts,

analyzed: lokasya anugraha arthāya sthāpitāḥ brahmaṇā bhuvi
translated: were established on earth by Brahma for the favor of the people.

original: prajānāṃ rakṣaṇaṃ dānaṃ yuddhaṃ kṣatrasya nirmitam
analyzed: prajānām rakṣaṇam dānam yuddham kṣatrasya nirmitam
translated: The protection of the people, charity, and war were ordained for the Kshatriyas.

original: kṛṣiś ca pāśupālyaṃ ca viśāṃ dānaṃ ca sarvaśaḥ🔽brahmakṣatraviśāṃ śūdrā vihitāḥ paricārakāḥ
analyzed: kṛṣiḥ ca pāśupālyam ca viśām dānam ca sarvaśas  brahma kṣatra viśām śūdrāḥ vihitāḥ paricārakāḥ
translated: Agriculture and animal husbandry are for the Vaishyas, and giving is for all.🔽Shudras are ordained to serve Brahmins, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas.

analyzed: brahma kṣatrasya vihitāḥ sūtāḥ vai paricārakāḥ
translated: Sutas are ordained to serve Brahmins and Kshatriyas.

original: na viṭśūdrasya tatraiva śṛṇu vākyaṃ mamānagha
analyzed: na viṣ śūdrasya tatra eva śṛṇu vākyam mama anagha
translated: Not for Vaishyas and Shudras. Listen to my words, O sinless one.

analyzed: saḥ ham mūrdhāvasiktaḥ san rājarṣi kula saṃbhavaḥ
translated: I, born in the lineage of rajarshis, consecrated on the head,

original: mahārathaḥ samākhyātaḥ sevyaḥ stavyaś ca bandinām🔽so 'ham etādṛśo bhūtvā nehārikulamardana
analyzed: mahā rathaḥ samākhyātaḥ sevyaḥ stavyaḥ ca bandinām  saḥ ham etādṛśaḥ bhūtvā na iha ari kula mardana
translated: am known as a maharatha, to be served and praised by bards.

analyzed: sūtaputrasya saṃgrāme sārathyam kartum utsahe
translated: Having become such, I do not dare to act as the charioteer in battle of the son of a suta, the oppressor of the Kuru lineage.

original: avamānam ahaṃ prāpya na yotsyāmi kathaṃ cana
analyzed: avamānam aham prāpya na yotsyāmi katham cana
translated: Having been insulted, I will never fight.

analyzed: āpṛcchya tvā adya gāndhāre gamiṣyāmi yathāgatam
translated: Having taken leave of you today, O son of Gandhari, I will go as I came.

analyzed: na ca aham sūtaputrasya sārathyam upajagmivān
translated: I did not accept the charioteership of the son of a suta.

analyzed: evam uktvā nara vyāghraḥ śalyaḥ samiti śobhanaḥ
translated: Having said this, Shalya, the best among men, the ornament of assemblies,

analyzed: utthāya prayayau tūrṇam rāja madhyāt amarṣitaḥ
translated: arose and quickly departed from the midst of the kings, filled with rage.

original: praṇayād bahumānāc ca taṃ nigṛhya sutas tava
analyzed: praṇayāt bahu mānāt ca tam nigṛhya sutaḥ tava
translated: Your son, out of affection and great respect, restrained him

analyzed: abravīt madhuram vākyam sāma sarva artha sādhakam
translated: and spoke to him sweet words, using conciliation, which accomplishes all objectives:

original: yathā śalya tvam ātthedam evam etad asaṃśayam
analyzed: yathā śalya tvam āttha idam evam etat asaṃśayam
translated: As you have said, O Shalya, it is so, there is no doubt about it.

original: abhiprāyas tu me kaś cit taṃ nibodha janeśvara
analyzed: abhiprāyaḥ tu me kaḥ cit tam nibodha janeśvara
translated: But I have a certain intention, understand it, O lord of men.

original: na karṇo 'bhyadhikas tvattaḥ śaṅke naiva kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na karṇaḥ bhyadhikaḥ tvattaḥ śaṅke nā eva katham cana
translated: I do not at all suspect that Karna is superior to you.

original: na hi madreśvaro rājā kuryād yad anṛtaṃ bhavet
analyzed: na hi madra īśvaraḥ rājā kuryāt yat anṛtam bhavet
translated: For the king, the lord of the Madras, would not do what would be false.

original: ṛtam eva hi pūrvās te vahanti puruṣottamāḥ
analyzed: ṛtam eva hi pūrvāḥ te vahanti puruṣa uttamāḥ
translated: For your ancestors, the best of men, have always followed truth.

original: jñātam eva hi pūrvaṃ te vartma rājarṣisattama
analyzed: jñātam eva hi pūrvam te vartma rājarṣi sattama
translated: You know well the path, O best of royal sages, from before.

original: tasmād ārtāyaniḥ prokto bhavān iti matir mama
analyzed: tasmāt ārtāyaniḥ proktaḥ bhavān iti matiḥ mama
translated: Therefore, I think you are called Artayani.

original: śalyabhūtaś ca śatrūṇāṃ yasmāt tvaṃ bhuvi mānada
analyzed: śalya bhūtaḥ ca śatrūṇām yasmāt tvam bhuvi mānada
translated: And because you are like a dart to your enemies, O giver of honor,

original: tasmāc chalyeti te nāma kathyate pṛthivīpate
analyzed: tasmāt śalya iti te nāma kathyate pṛthivīpate
translated: therefore your name is proclaimed as Shalya, O lord of the earth.

original: yad eva vyāhṛtaṃ pūrvaṃ bhavatā bhūridakṣiṇa
analyzed: yat eva vyāhṛtam pūrvam bhavatā bhūri dakṣiṇa
translated: What was said by you before, O giver of abundant gifts,

original: tad eva kuru dharmajña madarthaṃ yad yad ucyase
analyzed: tat eva kuru dharma jña mad artham yat yat ucyase
translated: Do that very thing, O righteous one, for my sake, whatever is said to you.

original: na ca tvatto hi rādheyo na cāham api vīryavān
analyzed: na ca tvattaḥ hi rādheyaḥ na ca aham api vīryavān
translated: For neither the son of Radha nor I, the powerful one,

original: vṛṇīmas tvāṃ hayāgryāṇāṃ yantāram iti saṃyuge
analyzed: vṛṇīmaḥ tvām haya agryāṇām yantāram iti saṃyuge
translated: choose you as the charioteer of the best horses in battle.

original: yathā hy abhyadhikaṃ karṇaṃ guṇais tāta dhanaṃjayāt
analyzed: yathā hi abhyadhikam karṇam guṇaiḥ tāta dhanaṃjayāt
translated: As Karna is superior to Dhananjaya in qualities, O son,

original: vāsudevād api tvāṃ ca loko 'yam iti manyate
analyzed: vāsudevāt api tvām ca lokaḥ yam iti manyate
translated: And this world considers you to be superior even to Vasudeva.

original: karṇo hy abhyadhikaḥ pārthād astrair eva nararṣabha
analyzed: karṇaḥ hi abhyadhikaḥ pārthāt astraiḥ eva nara ṛṣabha
translated: Karna is indeed superior to Partha in weapons, O bull among men.

original: bhavān apy adhikaḥ kṛṣṇād aśvayāne bale tathā
analyzed: bhavān api adhikaḥ kṛṣṇāt aśva yāne bale tathā
translated: And you are superior to Krishna in horsemanship and strength.

analyzed: yathā aśva hṛdayam veda vāsudevaḥ mahā manāḥ
translated: Just as the great-minded Vasudeva knows the heart of horses,

original: dviguṇaṃ tvaṃ tathā vettha madrarāja na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: dviguṇam tvam tathā vettha madra rāja na saṃśayaḥ
translated: there is no doubt that you know it twice as much, O king of Madra.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: yan mā bravīṣi gāndhāre madhye sainyasya kaurava
analyzed: yat mā bravīṣi gāndhāre madhye sainyasya kaurava
translated: What you say to me, O son of Gandhari, in the midst of the army, O Kourava,

original: viśiṣṭaṃ devakīputrāt prītimān asmy ahaṃ tvayi
analyzed: viśiṣṭam devakīputrāt prītimān asmi aham tvayi
translated: that Karna is superior to Devaki's son, I am pleased with you.

analyzed: eṣa sārathyam ātiṣṭhe rādheyasya yaśasvinaḥ
translated: I will take up the charioteering of the illustrious son of Radha,

original: yudhyataḥ pāṇḍavāgryeṇa yathā tvaṃ vīra manyase
analyzed: yudhyataḥ pāṇḍava agryeṇa yathā tvam vīra manyase
translated: while he fights with the foremost of the Pandavas, as you think, O hero.

original: samayaś ca hi me vīra kaś cid vaikartanaṃ prati
analyzed: samayaḥ ca hi me vīra kaḥ cit vaikartanam prati
translated: And I have a certain condition, O hero, regarding Vaikartana.

analyzed: utsṛjeyam yathāśraddham aham vācaḥ sya saṃnidhau
translated: I will speak my words in his presence, as I desire.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: tatheti rājan putras te saha karṇena bhārata
analyzed: tathā iti rājan putraḥ te saha karṇena bhārata
translated: So be it, O king, your son, together with Karna, O descendant of Bharata,

analyzed: abravīt madra rājasya sutam bharata sattama
translated: said to the son of the king of Madra, O best of the Bharata lineage.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: bhūya eva tu madreśa yat te vakṣyāmi tac chṛṇu
analyzed: bhūyas eva tu madra īśa yat te vakṣyāmi tat śṛṇu
translated: Listen again, O lord of Madra, to what I will tell you.

original: yathā purā vṛttam idaṃ yuddhe devāsure vibho
analyzed: yathā purā vṛttam idam yuddhe devāsure vibho
translated: O Lord, as it happened in the battle between the gods and demons in ancient times,

original: yad uktavān pitur mahyaṃ mārkaṇḍeyo mahān ṛṣiḥ
analyzed: yat uktavān pituḥ mahyam mārkaṇḍeyaḥ mahān ṛṣiḥ
translated: what the great sage Markandeya told my father,

analyzed: tat aśeṣeṇa bruvataḥ mama rājarṣi sattama
translated: as I relate it in its entirety, O best of royal sages,

original: tvaṃ nibodha na cāpy atra kartavyā te vicāraṇā
analyzed: tvam nibodha na ca api atra kartavyā te vicāraṇā
translated: you should listen to it without any doubt in this matter.

original: samutpannā hi rājānaḥ pramoha iti niścayaḥ
analyzed: samutpannāḥ hi rājānaḥ pramohaḥ iti niścayaḥ
translated: Kings are indeed born for the purpose of deluding, this is certain.

analyzed: kṛtvā ca eva vyavasyanti sarve dharma artha niścayān
translated: And having done so, they decide on the conclusions of dharma and artha.

original: devānām asurāṇāṃ ca mahān āsīt samāgamaḥ🔽saiṃhikeyās tadodvṛttā vibudhān avasūdayan
analyzed: devānām asurāṇām ca mahān āsīt samāgamaḥ  saiṃhikeyāḥ tadā udvṛttāḥ vibudhān avasūdayan
translated: There was a great encounter between the gods and the demons,🔽where the Saihhikeyas rose up and destroyed the gods.

original: te nirastāḥ kṛtā devair dānavā balagarvitāḥ
analyzed: te nirastāḥ kṛtāḥ devaiḥ dānavāḥ bala garvitāḥ
translated: Those Danavas, puffed up with pride in their strength, were expelled by the gods.

analyzed: babhūva prathamaḥ rājan saṃgrāmaḥ tārakā mayaḥ
translated: The first battle took place, O king, in the Tarakamaya war.

original: nirjitāś ca tadā daityā daivatair iti naḥ śrutam
analyzed: nirjitāḥ ca tadā daityāḥ daivataiḥ iti naḥ śrutam
translated: And it is heard by us that the Daityas were then defeated by the gods.

analyzed: bhagna darpāḥ nirutsāhāḥ pātālam viviśuḥ tadā
translated: Their pride shattered, they lost all enthusiasm and entered the nether regions.

original: nirjiteṣu ca daityeṣu tārakasya sutās trayaḥ
analyzed: nirjiteṣu ca daityeṣu tārakasya sutāḥ trayaḥ
translated: And when the Daityas were defeated, the three sons of Taraka,

original: tārākṣaḥ kamalākṣaś ca vidyunmālī ca pārthiva
analyzed: tārākṣaḥ kamalākṣaḥ ca vidyunmālī ca pārthiva
translated: Tarakaksha, Kamalaksha and Vidyunmali, O king,

original: kaś cit prajāpatir ghoras tena sārdhaṃ mahātmanā
analyzed: kaḥ cit prajāpatiḥ ghoraḥ tena sārdham mahātmanā
translated: with that great-souled one, a terrible Prajapati,

original: yuddham āsīn mahāghoraṃ daivatair na iti śrutiḥ🔽parābabhūvur asurā dānavaiḥ saha saṃyuge
analyzed: yuddham āsīt mahā ghoram daivataiḥ naḥ iti śrutiḥ  parābabhūvuḥ asurāḥ dānavaiḥ saha saṃyuge
translated: The battle that took place was extremely terrible, as is heard in the scriptures,🔽The asuras were defeated along with the danavas in the battle.

original: devair nirastā hy asurā niḥśvasyāmarṣitās tataḥ
analyzed: devaiḥ nirastāḥ hi asurāḥ niḥśvasya amarṣitāḥ tatas
translated: The asuras, rejected by the gods, became angry and sighed.

original: tapa ugraṃ samāsthāya niyame parame sthitāḥ
analyzed: tapaḥ ugram samāsthāya niyame parame sthitāḥ
translated: They undertook severe austerities and remained in supreme restraints.

original: tapasā karśayām āsur dehān svāñ śatrutāpana
analyzed: tapasā karśayām āsuḥ dehān svām śatru tāpana
translated: They emaciated their own bodies, O tormentor of enemies, through austerities.

original: damena tapasā caiva niyamena ca pārthiva
analyzed: damena tapasā ca eva niyamena ca pārthiva
translated: O king, through self-control, austerities, and restraints,

original: teṣāṃ pitāmahaḥ prīto varadaḥ pradadau varān
analyzed: teṣām pitāmahaḥ prītaḥ vara daḥ pradadau varān
translated: The grandfather, pleased with them, the granter of boons, bestowed boons on them.

original: avadhyatvaṃ ca te rājan sarvabhūteṣu sarvadā
analyzed: avadhya tvam ca te rājan sarva bhūteṣu sarvadā
translated: O king, they chose immortality from all beings at all times.

analyzed: sahitāḥ varayām āsuḥ sarva loka pitāmaham
translated: Together, they chose the grandfather of all the worlds.

original: tān abravīt tadā devo lokānāṃ prabhur īśvaraḥ
analyzed: tān abravīt tadā devaḥ lokānām prabhuḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: Then the god, the lord of the worlds, the supreme lord, said to them:

analyzed: na asti sarva amara tvam hi nivartadhvam surāḥ
translated: There is no immortality from all things. Turn back from this, O asuras.

original: varam anyaṃ vṛṇīdhvaṃ vai yādṛśaṃ saṃprarocate
analyzed: varam anyam vṛṇīdhvam vai yādṛśam saṃprarocate
translated: Choose another boon, whatever appeals to you.

original: tatas te sahitā rājan saṃpradhāryāsakṛd bahu
analyzed: tatas te sahitāḥ rājan saṃpradhārya asakṛt bahu
translated: Then they, together, O king, having deliberated much,

analyzed: sarva loka īśvaram vākyam praṇamya enam atha abruvan
translated: bowed to him, the lord of all the worlds, and said to him:

original: vayam icchāma nagaraṃ kartuṃ kāmagamaṃ śubham
analyzed: vayam icchāma nagaram kartum kāma gamam śubham
translated: We wish to build a city that is beautiful and can go wherever we want.

original: amoghāya mṛgākṣāya pravarāyudhayodhine🔽arhāya caiva śuddhāya kṣayāya krathanāya ca
analyzed: amoghāya mṛga akṣāya pravara āyudha yodhine  arhāya ca eva śuddhāya kṣayāya krathanāya ca
translated: to the unfailing, to the deer-eyed, to the warrior with the best weapons,🔽to the worthy, to the pure, to the destroyer, to the crusher,

analyzed: durvāraṇāya śukrāya brahmaṇe brahmacāriṇe
translated: to the irresistible, to the pure, to Brahman, to the celibate,

analyzed: īśānāya aprameyāya niyantre carma vāsase
translated: to the lord, to the immeasurable, to the controller, to the one clad in skin,

analyzed: tapaḥ nityāya piṅgāya vratine kṛttivāsase
translated: To the one who is always engaged in austerities, to the tawny one, to the one who observes vows, to the one who wears elephant hide,

analyzed: kumāra pitre tryakṣāya pravara āyudha dhāriṇe
translated: To the father of Kumara, to the three-eyed one, to the wielder of excellent weapons,

analyzed: prapanna ārti vināśāya brahma dviṣ saṃgha ghātine
translated: To the destroyer of the distress of those who have surrendered, to the slayer of the hordes of Brahma's enemies,

analyzed: vanaspatīnām pataye narāṇām pataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the lord of the forest trees, to the lord of men,

original: gavāṃ ca pataye nityaṃ yajñānāṃ pataye namaḥ
analyzed: gavām ca pataye nityam yajñānām pataye namaḥ
translated: And always to the lord of the cows, to the lord of the sacrifices.

analyzed: namaḥ stu te sa sainyāya tryambakāya ugra tejase
translated: Salutations to you, O destroyer of the three cities, to the one with fierce splendor,

original: manovākkarmabhir deva tvāṃ prapannān bhajasva naḥ
analyzed: manaḥ vāc karmabhiḥ deva tvām prapannān bhajasva naḥ
translated: O god, accept us who have surrendered to you in thought, word, and deed.

analyzed: tatas prasannaḥ bhagavān svāgatena abhinandya tān
translated: Then the Blessed Lord, pleased, welcomed them with the words of welcome,

original: provāca vyetu vastrāso brūta kiṃ karavāṇi vaḥ
analyzed: provāca vyetu vaḥ trāsaḥ brūta kim karavāṇi vaḥ
translated: And said, Let fear be dispelled. Tell me, what shall I do for you?

original: devāḥ śarvasya vacanaṃ śrutvā harṣam upāgatāḥ
analyzed: devāḥ śarvasya vacanam śrutvā harṣam upāgatāḥ
translated: Having heard the words of Sharva, the gods were filled with joy,

analyzed: pitṛ deva ṛṣi saṃghebhyaḥ vare datte mahātmanā
translated: When the boon was granted to the groups of ancestors, gods, and sages by the great-souled one.

original: satkṛtya śaṃkaraṃ prāha brahmā lokahitaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: satkṛtya śaṃkaram prāha brahmā loka hitam vacaḥ
translated: Having honored Shankara, Brahma spoke these words for the welfare of the world:

original: imāny asuradurgāṇi lokāṃs trīn ākramanti ca
analyzed: imāni asura durgāṇi lokān trīn ākramanti ca
translated: These demons are oppressing the three worlds.

original: kaś ca prajāpatir ghorāṃs tān sarvāñ jahi māciram
analyzed: kaḥ ca prajāpatiḥ ghorān tān sarvām jahi māciram
translated: O Prajapati, destroy all those terrible ones without delay.

analyzed: tava atisargāt deveśa prājāpatyam idam padam
translated: O Lord of gods, this position of Prajapati is due to your grace.

analyzed: mayā adhitiṣṭhatā dattaḥ dānavebhyaḥ mahān varaḥ
translated: I, the granter of boons, have granted a great boon to the demons.

original: nāsty anyo yudhi teṣāṃ vai nihantā iti naḥ śrutam🔽tān atikrāntamaryādān nānyaḥ saṃhartum arhati
analyzed: na asti anyaḥ yudhi teṣām vai nihantā iti naḥ śrutam  tān atikrānta maryādān na anyaḥ saṃhartum arhati
translated: I, having bestowed a great boon on the demons, said, There is none else who can kill them in battle, this we have heard.🔽Except you, O Lord of the past and future, no one else deserves to destroy them who have transgressed the bounds of morality.

original: tvām ṛte bhūtabhavyeśa tvaṃ hy eṣāṃ pratyarir vadhe🔽sa tvaṃ deva prapannānāṃ yācatāṃ ca divaukasām
analyzed: tvām ṛte bhūta bhavya īśa tvam hi eṣām pratyariḥ vadhe  sa tvam deva prapannānām yācatām ca divaukasām
translated: You are indeed their enemy in the destruction.🔽Therefore, O God, be gracious to the dwellers of heaven who have sought refuge in you and who are supplicating you.

original: kuru prasādaṃ deveśa dānavāñ jahi śūlabhṛt
analyzed: kuru prasādam deveśa jahi śūlabhṛt
translated: O Lord of gods, O wielder of the trident, destroy the demons.

original: tvatprasāj jagat sarvaṃ sukham aidhata mānada
analyzed: tvad prasāt jagat sarvam sukham aidhata mānada
translated: O bestower of honor, by your grace the entire world will be happy.

original: śaraṇyas tvaṃ hi lokeśa te vayaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ
analyzed: śaraṇyaḥ tvam hi lokeśa te vayam śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: O Lord of the world, you are the refuge. We have sought refuge in you.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: hantavyāḥ śatravaḥ sarve yuṣmākam iti me matiḥ
analyzed: hantavyāḥ śatravaḥ sarve yuṣmākam iti me matiḥ
translated: It is my opinion that all your enemies should be killed.

original: na tv eko 'haṃ vadhe teṣāṃ samartho vai suradviṣām
analyzed: na tu ekaḥ ham vadhe teṣām samarthaḥ vai suradviṣām
translated: But I alone am not capable of destroying those enemies of the gods.

analyzed: te yūyam sahitāḥ sarve madīyena astra tejasā
translated: Therefore, all of you together, by the power of my weapon,

original: jayadhvaṃ yudhi tāñ śatrūn saṃghāto hi mahābalaḥ
analyzed: jayadhvam yudhi tām śatrūn saṃghātaḥ hi mahā balaḥ
translated: conquer those enemies in battle. For an alliance is indeed very powerful.

analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: asmattejobalaṃ yāvat tāvad dviguṇam eva ca
analyzed: asmad tejaḥ balam yāvat tāvat dviguṇam eva ca
translated: We think that their power and strength is twice that of ours,

original: teṣām iti ha manyāmo dṛṣṭatejobalā hi te
analyzed: teṣām iti ha manyāmaḥ dṛṣṭa tejaḥ balāḥ hi te
translated: for we have seen their power and strength.

analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: vadhyās te sarvataḥ pāpā ye yuṣmāsv aparādhinaḥ
analyzed: vadhyāḥ te sarvatas pāpāḥ ye yuṣmāsu aparādhinaḥ
translated: Those sinners who have offended you should be killed by you in every way.

original: mama tejobalārdhena sarvāṃs tān ghnata śātravān
analyzed: mama tejaḥ bala ardhena sarvān tān ghnata śātravān
translated: With half of my energy and strength, kill all those enemies of yours.

analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: bibhartuṃ tejaso 'rdhaṃ te na śakṣyāmo maheśvara
analyzed: bibhartum tejasaḥ ṛdham te na śakṣyāmaḥ maheśvara
translated: O Maheśvara, we will not be able to bear half of your energy.

original: sarveṣāṃ no balārdhena tvam eva jahi śātravān
analyzed: sarveṣām naḥ bala ardhena tvam eva jahi śātravān
translated: With half the strength of all of us, you alone kill the enemies.

original: vayaṃ ca sarvathā deva rakṣaṇīyās tathaiva ca
analyzed: vayam ca sarvathā deva rakṣaṇīyāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: And we too, O god, are to be protected in every way.

original: sa no rakṣa mahādeva tvam eva jahi śātravān
analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣa mahādeva tvam eva jahi śātravān
translated: Therefore, protect us, O Mahādeva, you alone kill the enemies.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: yadi śaktir na vaḥ kā cid vibhartuṃ māmakaṃ balam
analyzed: yadi śaktiḥ na vaḥ kā cit vibhartum māmakam balam
translated: If you have no power to bear my strength,

analyzed: aham etān haniṣyāmi yuṣmat
translated: I will kill them, empowered by half of your energy.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: tatas tatheti deveśas tair ukto rājasattama
analyzed: tatas tathā iti deveśaḥ taiḥ uktaḥ rāja sattama
translated: Then, O best of kings, the Lord of the gods said So be it to them.

analyzed: ardham ādāya sarvebhyaḥ tejasā abhyadhikaḥ bhavat
translated: Taking half from all of them, he became superior in energy.

original: sa tu devo balenāsīt sarvebhyo balavattaraḥ🔽mahādeva iti khyātas tadāprabhṛti śaṃkaraḥ
analyzed: sa tu devaḥ balena āsīt sarvebhyaḥ balavattaraḥ  mahādevaḥ iti khyātaḥ tadā prabhṛti śaṃkaraḥ
translated: And that god became stronger than all in strength.🔽From that time onwards, Śaṅkara became known as Mahādeva.

original: tato 'bravīn mahādevo dhanur bāṇadharas tv aham
analyzed: tatas bravīt mahādevaḥ dhanuḥ bāṇa dharaḥ tu aham
translated: Then Mahādeva said, I will hold a bow and arrow.

original: haniṣyāmi rathenājau tān ripūn vai divaukasaḥ
analyzed: haniṣyāmi rathena ājau tān ripūn vai divaukasaḥ
translated: I will kill those enemies of the gods in battle with my chariot.

original: te yūyaṃ me rathaṃ caiva dhanur bāṇaṃ tathaiva ca
analyzed: te yūyam me ratham ca eva dhanuḥ bāṇam tathā eva ca
translated: You all see my chariot, bow and arrow,

analyzed: paśyadhvam yāvat adya etān pātayāmi mahī tale
translated: until today I bring down these on the ground.

analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

analyzed: mūrti sarva svam ādāya trailokyasya tatas tatas
translated: Then, taking the totality of forms from here and there in the three worlds,

analyzed: ratham te kalpayiṣyāma deveśvara mahā ojasam
translated: we will create for you, O Lord of gods, a chariot of great splendor.

analyzed: tathā eva buddhyā vihitam viśvakarma kṛtam śubham
translated: And likewise, created by Vishvakarma, it is auspicious and designed with intelligence.

analyzed: tatas vibudha śārdūlāḥ tam ratham samakalpayan
translated: Then the best of the gods created that chariot.

original: viṣṇuṃ somaṃ hutāśaṃ ca tasyeṣuṃ samakalpayan
analyzed: viṣṇum somam hutāśam ca tasya iṣum samakalpayan
translated: They created Vishnu, Soma and Hutashana as its arrows.

original: śṛṅgam agnir babhūvāsya bhallaḥ somo viśāṃ pate
analyzed: śṛṅgam agniḥ babhūva asya bhallaḥ somaḥ viśām pate
translated: O lord of the people, Agni became its horn, Soma its arrowhead,

original: kuḍmalaś cābhavad viṣṇus tasminn iṣuvare tadā
analyzed: kuḍmalaḥ ca abhavat viṣṇuḥ tasmin iṣu vare tadā
translated: and Vishnu its tip on that excellent arrow.

analyzed: vandhuram pṛthivīm devīm viśāla pura mālinīm
translated: The goddess earth, with its extensive cities and garlands,

analyzed: sa parvata vana dvīpām cakruḥ bhūta dharām tadā
translated: with its mountains, forests and islands, they made it the bearer of beings.

original: mandaraṃ parvataṃ cākṣaṃ jaṅghās tasya mahānadīḥ
analyzed: mandaram parvatam ca akṣam jaṅghāḥ tasya mahā nadīḥ
translated: Mount Mandara was its axle, its great rivers its shanks,

original: diśaś ca pradiśaś caiva parivāraṃ rathasya hi
analyzed: diśaḥ ca pradiśaḥ ca eva parivāram rathasya hi
translated: and the directions and sub-directions were the chariot's enclosure.

analyzed: īṣā nakṣatravaṃśaḥ ca yugaḥ kṛtayugaḥ bhavat
translated: The lunar mansion was its shaft, and the Krita age was its yoke.

analyzed: kūbaraḥ ca rathasya āsīt vāsukiḥ bhujaga uttamaḥ
translated: And Vasuki, the best of serpents, was the pole of the chariot.

analyzed: apaskaram adhiṣṭhāne himavān vindhya parvataḥ
translated: The Himalayas and Vindhya mountain were made the axles,

analyzed: udaya astau adhiṣṭhāne girī cakruḥ sura uttamāḥ
translated: and the rising and setting mountains were made the excellent wheels by the best of gods.

analyzed: samudram akṣam asṛjan dānava ālayam uttamam
translated: They created the ocean as the excellent abode of the demons.

analyzed: saptarṣi maṇḍalam ca eva rathasya āsīt pariṣkaraḥ
translated: The circle of the seven sages became the fender of the chariot.

original: gaṅgā sarasvatī sindhur dhuram ākāśam eva ca
analyzed: gaṅgā sarasvatī sindhuḥ dhuram ākāśam eva ca
translated: The Ganges, Sarasvati, Sindhu, and the sky were made the yoke,

original: upaskaro rathasyāsann āpaḥ sarvāś ca nimnagāḥ
analyzed: upaskaraḥ rathasya āsan āpaḥ sarvāḥ ca nimnagāḥ
translated: and all the waters and rivers were the equipment of the chariot.

original: ahorātrāḥ kalāś caiva kāṣṭhāś ca ṛtavas tathā
analyzed: ahar rātrāḥ kalāḥ ca eva kāṣṭhāḥ ca ṛtavaḥ tathā
translated: The days and nights, the kalas, kashthas, and the seasons,

original: anukarṣān grahān dīptān varūthaṃ cāpi tārakāḥ
analyzed: anukarṣān grahān dīptān varūtham ca api tārakāḥ
translated: the blazing planets, and the stars were the chariot's fender.

analyzed: dharma artha kāma saṃyuktam triveṇum ca api bandhuram
translated: It was endowed with dharma, artha, and kama, and had a triple bamboo pole.

analyzed: oṣadhīḥ vividhāḥ tatra nānā puṣpa phala udgamāḥ
translated: There were various herbs producing various flowers and fruits.

analyzed: sūryācandramasau kṛtvā cakre ratha vara uttame
translated: The sun and moon were made the wheels of that excellent chariot.

original: pakṣau pūrvāparau tatra kṛte rātryahanī śubhe
analyzed: pakṣau pūrva aparau tatra kṛte rātri ahanī śubhe
translated: The auspicious day and night were made the east and west sides.

analyzed: daśa nāga patīn īṣām dhṛtarāṣṭra mukhān dṛḍhām
translated: The ten lords of the nagas headed by Dhritarashtra were made the strong shaft,

original: yoktrāṇi cakrur nāgāṃś ca niḥśvasanto mahoragān
analyzed: yoktrāṇi cakruḥ nāgān ca niḥśvasantaḥ mahā uragān
translated: and the exhaling great serpents were made the reins.

analyzed: dyām yugam yugacarmāṇi saṃvartaka balāhakān
translated: The sky was the yoke, the clouds of the dissolution were the leather coverings of the yoke,

analyzed: kālapṛṣṭhaḥ tha nahuṣaḥ karkoṭaka dhanaṃjayau
translated: Kālapriṣṭha, Nahuṣa, Karkoṭaka, and Dhanañjaya,

analyzed: itare ca abhavan nāgāḥ hayānām vāla bandhanāḥ
translated: and other nāgas became the reins of the horses.

original: diśaś ca pradiśaś caiva raśmayo rathavājinām
analyzed: diśaḥ ca pradiśaḥ ca eva raśmayaḥ ratha vājinām
translated: The directions and the intermediate directions were the reins of the chariot horses,

analyzed: aśvāḥ ca vedāḥ catvāraḥ purāṇa aṅga vibhūṣitāḥ
translated: and the four Vedas adorned with the Purāṇas and Aṅgas were the horses.

original: śamyāṃ dhṛtiṃ ca medhāṃ ca sthitiṃ saṃnatim eva ca
analyzed: śamyām dhṛtim ca medhām ca sthitim saṃnatim eva ca
translated: Śamī, Dhṛti, Medhā, Sthiti, and Samnati,

analyzed: graha nakṣatra tārābhiḥ carma citram nabhastalam
translated: the sky was the variegated banner with the planets, stars, and constellations,

analyzed: surā ambu preta vittānām patīn loka īśvarān hayān
translated: the lords of the worlds, the husbands of the gods, water, ghosts, and wealth, were the horses,

original: sinīvālīm anumatiṃ kuhūṃ rākāṃ ca suvratām
analyzed: sinīvālīm anumatim kuhūm rākām ca suvratām
translated: and Sinīvālī, Anumati, Kuhū, and Rākā of good vows,

original: yoktrāṇi cakrur vāhānāṃ rohakāṃś cāpi kaṇṭhakam
analyzed: yoktrāṇi cakruḥ vāhānām rohakān ca api kaṇṭhakam
translated: they made the yokes for the vehicles and also the halter for Kaṇṭhaka.

original: karma satyaṃ tapo 'rthaś ca vihitās tatra raśmayaḥ
analyzed: karma satyam tapaḥ rthaḥ ca vihitāḥ tatra raśmayaḥ
translated: Action, truth, austerity, and purpose were arranged there as the reins,

original: adhiṣṭhānaṃ manas tv āsīt parirathyaṃ sarasvatī
analyzed: adhiṣṭhānam manaḥ tu āsīt parirathyam sarasvatī
translated: the mind was the foundation, and Sarasvatī was the outer enclosure of the chariot.

original: nānāvarṇāś ca citrāś ca patākāḥ pavaneritāḥ
analyzed: nānā varṇāḥ ca citrāḥ ca patākāḥ pavana īritāḥ
translated: And the variegated and colorful flags, blown by the wind,

analyzed: vidyut indradhanuḥ naddham ratham dīptam vyadīpayat
translated: the lightning and Indra's rainbow illuminated the blazing chariot.

analyzed: vaṣaṭkāraḥ pratodaḥ bhūt gāyatrī śīrṣa bandhanā
translated: The Vaṣaṭkāra was the whip, and the Gāyatrī was the head-bandage,

original: yo yajñe vihitaḥ pūrvam īśānasya mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ yajñe vihitaḥ pūrvam īśānasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: whatever was arranged in the sacrifice before for the great lord Īśāna,

original: saṃvatsaro dhanus tad vai sāvitrī jyā mahāsvanā
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ dhanuḥ tat vai sāvitrī jyā mahā svanā
translated: The year was the bow, Savitri was the great sounding bowstring,

original: divyaṃ ca varma vihitaṃ mahārhaṃ ratnabhūṣitam
analyzed: divyam ca varma vihitam mahārham ratna bhūṣitam
translated: A celestial and expensive armor was made, adorned with jewels,

analyzed: abhedyam virajaskam vai kālacakra bahiṣkṛtam
translated: Impenetrable, dust-free, outside the wheel of time,

analyzed: dhvaja yaṣṭiḥ abhūt meruḥ śrīmān kanakaparvataḥ
translated: Meru, the glorious golden mountain, became the flagstaff,

analyzed: patākāḥ ca abhavan meghāḥ taḍidbhiḥ samalaṃkṛtāḥ
translated: The clouds, adorned with lightning, became the flags,

analyzed: rejuḥ adhvaryu madhya sthāḥ jvalantaḥ iva pāvakāḥ
translated: They shone in the midst of the Adhvaryus, like blazing fires.

original: kḷptaṃ tu taṃ rathaṃ dṛṣṭvā vismitā devatābhavan
analyzed: kḷptam tu tam ratham dṛṣṭvā vismitāḥ devatāḥ abhavan
translated: Seeing that chariot thus prepared, the gods were amazed,

analyzed: sarva lokasya tejāṃsi dṛṣṭvā ekasthāni māriṣa
translated: Seeing the splendor of all the worlds gathered in one place, O venerable one,

original: yuktaṃ nivedayām āsur devās tasmai mahātmane
analyzed: yuktam nivedayām āsuḥ devāḥ tasmai mahātmane
translated: The gods informed that great soul of the arrangement,

analyzed: evam tasmin mahā rāja kalpite ratha sattame
translated: Thus, O great king, when that best of chariots was prepared,

analyzed: devaiḥ manuja śārdūla dviṣatām abhimardane
translated: By the gods, O tiger among men, for crushing the enemies,

original: svāny āyudhāni mukhyāni nyadadhāc chaṃkaro rathe
analyzed: svāni āyudhāni mukhyāni nyadadhāt śaṃkaraḥ rathe
translated: Shankara placed his own foremost weapons on the chariot,

analyzed: ratha yaṣṭim viyat kṛṣṭām sthāpayām āsa go vṛṣam
translated: He placed the bull, drawn through the sky, on the chariot staff,
Brahma's staff, Time's staff, Rudra's staff, and Fever,

analyzed: pariskandāḥ rathasya asya sarvatodiśam udyatāḥ
translated: Were raised all around in all directions as the chariot's guards.

analyzed: atharva aṅgirasau āstām cakrarakṣau mahātmanaḥ
translated: Atharva and Angirasa were the protectors of the wheels of the great one.

original: ṛgvedaḥ sāmavedaś ca purāṇaṃ ca puraḥsarāḥ
analyzed: ṛgvedaḥ sāmavedaḥ ca purāṇam ca puraḥsarāḥ
translated: The Rig Veda, Sama Veda and Purana were the leaders.

analyzed: itihāsa yajurvedau pṛṣṭharakṣau babhūvatuḥ
translated: The Itihasa and Yajur Veda were the rear guards.

original: divyā vācaś ca vidyāś ca paripārśvacarāḥ kṛtāḥ🔽tottrādayaś ca rājendra vaṣaṭkāras tathaiva ca
analyzed: divyāḥ vācaḥ ca vidyāḥ ca paripārśva carāḥ kṛtāḥ  tottra ādayaḥ ca rāja indra vaṣaṭkāraḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The divine speech and the lores were made to attend on the sides.🔽O king of kings, the sounds of tut tut and vashatkara

analyzed: oṃkāraḥ ca mukhe rājan ati śobhā karaḥ bhavat
translated: and the sound Om became the face, enhancing the beauty.

original: vicitram ṛtubhiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ kṛtvā saṃvatsaraṃ dhanuḥ
analyzed: vicitram ṛtubhiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ kṛtvā saṃvatsaram dhanuḥ
translated: Having made the year with its six seasons the bow,

original: chāyām evātmanaś cakre dhanur jyām akṣayāṃ raṇe
analyzed: chāyām eva ātmanaḥ cakre dhanuḥ jyām akṣayām raṇe
translated: he made his own shadow the inexhaustible bowstring in the battle.

original: kālo hi bhagavān rudras tasya saṃvatsaro dhanuḥ

analyzed: puṇya gandha vaham rājam śvasanam rāja sattama  tam āsthāya mahādevaḥ trāsayan daivatāni api
translated: O king, the wind, bearing auspicious fragrance, O best of kings,🔽Mounting that, Mahadeva, as if making the earth and sky tremble,

analyzed: āruroha tadā yattaḥ kampayan iva rodasī  tam ārurukṣum deveśam tuṣṭuvuḥ parama ṛṣayaḥ

analyzed: sa śobhamānaḥ vara daḥ khaḍgī bāṇī śarāsanī

analyzed: tam abruvan deva gaṇāḥ yam bhavān saṃniyokṣyate

analyzed: sa bhaviṣyati deveśa sārathiḥ te na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O lord of the gods, will undoubtedly be your charioteer.

original: tān abravīt punar devo mattaḥ śreṣṭhataro hi yaḥ
analyzed: tān abravīt punar devaḥ mattaḥ śreṣṭhataraḥ hi yaḥ
translated: The god then said to them, He who is superior to me,

analyzed: tam sārathim kurudhvam me svayam saṃcintya māciram
translated: choose him as my charioteer yourselves, without delay.

analyzed: etat śrutvā tatas devāḥ vākyam uktam mahātmanā

analyzed: deva tvayā idam kathitam tridaśa ari nibarhaṇam
translated: O god, this was told by you, the destroyer of the enemies of the thirty gods,

original: tathā ca kṛtam asmābhiḥ prasanno vṛṣabhadhvajaḥ
analyzed: tathā ca kṛtam asmābhiḥ prasannaḥ vṛṣabhadhvajaḥ

analyzed: rathaḥ ca vihitaḥ smābhiḥ vicitra āyudha saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: And the chariot has been made by us, surrounded by various weapons.

original: sārathiṃ tu na jānīmaḥ kaḥ syāt tasmin rathottame
analyzed: sārathim tu na jānīmaḥ kaḥ syāt tasmin ratha uttame

analyzed: tasmāt vidhīyatām kaḥ cit sārathiḥ deva sattama
translated: Therefore, O best of gods, appoint someone as the charioteer.

analyzed: saphalām tām giram deva kartum arhasi naḥ vibho
translated: O god, it is proper for you to make that statement of yours fruitful, O lord.

original: evam asmāsu hi purā bhagavann uktavān asi
analyzed: evam asmāsu hi purā bhagavan uktavān asi
translated: For in the past, O Blessed One, you spoke thus to us:

analyzed: hitam kartāsmi bhavatām iti tat kartum arhasi  sa deva yuktaḥ ratha sattamaḥ naḥ
translated: 'I will do what is beneficial for you.' It is proper for you to do that.🔽That excellent chariot of ours, O god, is yoked,

analyzed: durāvaraḥ drāvaṇaḥ śātravāṇām  pinākapāṇiḥ vihitaḥ tra yoddhā
translated: invincible, able to crush the enemies.🔽The wielder of the Pinaka has been appointed as the warrior here,

analyzed: vibhīṣayan dānavān udyataḥ sau
translated: ready to frighten the demons.

analyzed: tathā eva vedāḥ caturaḥ hayā agryā
translated: In the same way, the four Vedas are the excellent horses,

analyzed: dharā sa śailā ca rathaḥ mahātman
translated: the earth with its mountains is the chariot of the great soul,

analyzed: nakṣatra vaṃśaḥ nugataḥ varūthe
translated: the constellation group follows in the rear.

analyzed: yasmin yoddhā sārathinā abhirakṣyaḥ
translated: In which the warrior is protected by the charioteer,

original: tatra sārathir eṣṭavyaḥ sarvair etair viśeṣavān
analyzed: tatra sārathiḥ eṣṭavyaḥ sarvaiḥ etaiḥ viśeṣavān

analyzed: tad pratiṣṭhaḥ rathaḥ deva hayāḥ yoddhā tathā eva ca

original: kavacāni ca śastrāṇi kārmukaṃ ca pitāmaha
analyzed: kavacāni ca śastrāṇi kārmukam ca pitāmaha
translated: The armors, weapons and the bow, O Grandfather.

original: tvām ṛte sārathiṃ tatra nānyaṃ paśyāmahe vayam
analyzed: tvām ṛte sārathim tatra na anyam paśyāmahe vayam
translated: Without you as the charioteer there, we do not see anyone else.

original: tvaṃ hi sarvair guṇair yukto devatābhyo 'dhikaḥ prabho
analyzed: tvam hi sarvaiḥ guṇaiḥ yuktaḥ devatābhyaḥ dhikaḥ prabho

original: tvaṃ deva śakto loke 'smin niyantuṃ pradrutān imān
analyzed: tvam deva śaktaḥ loke smin niyantum pradrutān imān

analyzed: adhikaḥ sārathiḥ kāryaḥ na asti ca anyaḥ dhikaḥ bhavān

analyzed: sa bhavān tārayatu asmān kuru sārathyam avyaya

analyzed: bhavān abhyadhikaḥ tvattaḥ na anyaḥ sti bhavitā tu iha

analyzed: tam ratham tvam samāruhya saṃyaccha paramān hayān

analyzed: tava prasādāt vadhyeyuḥ deva daivata kaṇṭakāḥ

analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣa mahā bāho daityebhyaḥ mahataḥ bhayāt

analyzed: tvad prasādāt surāḥ sarve pūjyante tridive prabho
translated: By your grace, O Lord, all the gods are worshipped in heaven.

analyzed: sārathye tūrṇam āroha saṃyaccha paramān hayān
translated: Quickly ascend the chariot as the charioteer and control the supreme horses.

analyzed: jayāya tridiva īśānām vadhāya tridaśa dviṣām
translated: For the victory of the gods and the destruction of the enemies of the gods.

original: iti te śirasā natvā trilokeśaṃ pitāmaham
analyzed: iti te śirasā natvā triloka īśam pitāmaham

analyzed: devāḥ prasādayām āsuḥ sārathyāya iti naḥ śrutam

analyzed: brahmā uvāca

analyzed: evam etat surāḥ tathyam na anyaḥ tu abhyadhikaḥ bhavān

analyzed: sārathi tvam kariṣyāmi śaṃkarasya mahātmanaḥ

analyzed: sarvathā rathinaḥ śreyān kartavyaḥ ratha sārathiḥ

original: tasmād etad yathātattvaṃ jñātvā yuṣmāṃś ca saṃgatān
analyzed: tasmāt etat yathātattvam jñātvā yuṣmān ca saṃgatān

analyzed: saṃyacchāmi hayān eṣa yudhyataḥ vai kapardinaḥ
translated: I will control the horses while Kapardin (Shiva) fights.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ
translated: Duryodhana

analyzed: evam uktvā jaṭā bhāram saṃyamya prapitāmahaḥ
translated: Having said this, the great-grandfather, with matted locks,

translated: wearing a deer skin tightly, and carrying a water pot,

analyzed: pratoda pāṇiḥ bhagavān āruroha ratham tadā

original: tataḥ sa bhagavān devo lokasraṣṭā pitāmahaḥ
analyzed: tatas sa bhagavān devaḥ loka sraṣṭā pitāmahaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed Lord, the Creator of the worlds, the Grandfather,

analyzed: tasmin ārohati kṣipram syandanam loka pūjite
translated: When that worshiped of the worlds quickly mounted the chariot,

analyzed: śirobhiḥ agaman tūrṇam te hayāḥ vāta raṃhasaḥ

analyzed: abhīśubhiḥ tu bhagavān udyamya ca hayān vibhuḥ

analyzed: tatas utthāpya bhagavān tān hayān anila upamān

translated: That giver of boons, shining with sword, bow, and arrows,

analyzed: dhāvamānaiḥ samantāt ca tarjamānaiḥ parasparam

analyzed: āśaṃsuḥ vai jayam devāḥ mahādevasya sarvaśas

analyzed: tuṣṭam āsīt jagat sarvam devatāḥ ca narottama
translated: The entire world was satisfied, O best of men, and the gods

analyzed: vādayanti prayāṇe sya vādyāni vividhāni ca

analyzed: sādhu sādhu iti viśveśaḥ smayamānaḥ bhyabhāṣata

analyzed: yāhi deva yatas daityāḥ codaya aśvān atandritaḥ

analyzed: paśya bāhvoḥ balam me dya nighnataḥ śātravān raṇe

original: tatas tāṃś codayām āsa vāyuvegasamāñ jave
analyzed: tatas tān codayām āsa vāyu vega samām jave

analyzed: yena tat tripuram rājan daitya dānava rakṣitam
translated: O king, by which (means) that Tripura, protected by the daityas and danavas,

translated: Then those horses named after the Vedas, having suddenly risen up,

analyzed: kṣaṇena tāni daityānām purāṇi prāpayan prabhum

translated: When Bhava, having mounted the chariot, proceeded towards Tripura,

analyzed: evam uktaḥ pratyuvāca tryambakam vara dam prabhum

analyzed: etat śrutvā ca vacanam pratigṛhya ca sarvaśas
translated: Having heard these words and accepted them in every way,

analyzed: preṣitaḥ devadevena vaḥ vijetum mahā asurāḥ

original: ity uktā bhārgaveṇātha daityā yuddhaṃ pracakramuḥ
analyzed: iti uktāḥ bhārgaveṇa atha daityāḥ yuddham pracakramuḥ

analyzed: sa tān nihatya samare daityān bhārgava nandanaḥ  vajra aśani sama sparśaiḥ prahāraiḥ eva bhārgavaḥ
translated: Having killed those demons in battle, the descendant of Bhrigu🔽The descendant of Bhrigu, with blows having the touch of Indra's thunderbolt,

analyzed: sa dānavaiḥ kṣata tanuḥ jāmadagnyaḥ dvijottamaḥ
translated: The son of Jamadagni, the best of the twice-born, with his body wounded by the demons,

analyzed: saṃspṛṣṭaḥ sthāṇunā sadyas nirvraṇaḥ samajāyata

original: prītaś ca bhagavān devaḥ karmaṇā tena tasya vai
analyzed: prītaḥ ca bhagavān devaḥ karmaṇā tena tasya vai
translated: And the illustrious god, pleased with that deed of his,

analyzed: uktaḥ ca devadevena prīti yuktena śūlinā

original: nipātāt tava śastrāṇāṃ śarīre yābhavad rujā

analyzed: tayā te mānuṣam karma vyapoḍham bhṛgu nandana

analyzed: gṛhāṇa astrāṇi divyāni mad sakāśāt yathā īpsitam  tatas strāṇi samastāni varān ca manasā īpsitān

analyzed: labdhvā bahuvidhān rāmaḥ praṇamya śirasā śivam

analyzed: evam etat purāvṛttam tadā kathitavān ṛṣiḥ

analyzed: bhārgavaḥ pi adadāt sarvam dhanurvedam mahātmane
translated: The descendant of Bhrigu also gave the great-souled one the entire science of archery,

analyzed: karṇāya puruṣa vyāghra su prītena antarātmanā

analyzed: nirjitya samare śūraḥ virathaḥ ca balātkṛtaḥ

analyzed: yaḥ hanyāt samare kruddhaḥ vajrahastam puraṃdaram
translated: Who, if enraged in battle, could kill even Purandara, the wielder of the thunderbolt.

analyzed: tvam ca sarva astra vid vīraḥ sarva vidyā astra pāragaḥ
translated: You are a hero skilled in all weapons, a master of all knowledge and weapons.

original: bāhuvīryeṇa te tulyaḥ pṛthivyāṃ nāsti kaś cana
analyzed: bāhu vīryeṇa te tulyaḥ pṛthivyām na asti kaḥ cana

analyzed: tvam śalya bhūtaḥ śatrūṇām aviṣahyaḥ parākrame
translated: You are like a thorn to the enemies, unassailable in valor.

original: tatas tvam ucyase rājañ śalya ity arisūdana
analyzed: tatas tvam ucyase rājam śalyaḥ iti ari sūdana
translated: Therefore, O king, you are called Shalya, O destroyer of enemies.

analyzed: tava bāhu balam prāpya na śekuḥ sarva sātvatāḥ
translated: Having obtained the strength of your arms, all the Satvatas were unable🔽to defeat the Pandavas in battle, O king.

analyzed: tava bāhu balāt rājan kim nu kṛṣṇaḥ bala adhikaḥ

analyzed: kimartham samare sainyam vāsudevaḥ nyavārayat

analyzed: kimartham ca bhavān sainyam na haniṣyati māriṣa

analyzed: tvad kṛte padavīm gantum iccheyam yudhi māriṣa
translated: For your sake, I wish to follow in your footsteps in battle, O venerable one.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: sodarāṇāṃ ca vīrāṇāṃ sarveṣāṃ ca mahīkṣitām
analyzed: sodarāṇām ca vīrāṇām sarveṣām ca mahīkṣitām
translated: For the sake of my brothers, all the brave ones, and all the kings,

original: yan māṃ bravīṣi gāndhāre agre sainyasya mānada
analyzed: yat mām bravīṣi gāndhāre agre sainyasya mānada
translated: what you say to me, O son of Gandhari, in front of the army, O bestower of honor,

analyzed: viśiṣṭam devakīputrāt prītimān asmi aham tvayi

analyzed: eṣa sārathyam ātiṣṭhe rādheyasya yaśasvinaḥ
translated: I will take up the charioteering of the illustrious son of Radha

original: yudhyataḥ pāṇḍavāgryeṇa yathā tvāṃ vīra manyase
analyzed: yudhyataḥ pāṇḍava agryeṇa yathā tvām vīra manyase
translated: while he fights with the foremost of the Pandavas, as you, O hero, desire.

original: samayaś ca hi me vīra kaś cid vaikartanaṃ prati
analyzed: samayaḥ ca hi me vīra kaḥ cit vaikartanam prati
translated: And, O hero, I have a certain condition regarding Vaikartana.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: utsṛjeyam yathāśraddham aham vācaḥ sya saṃnidhau
translated: I will utter these words according to my faith in his presence.

analyzed: sārathyasya abhyupagamāt śalyena āśvāsitaḥ tadā

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ tadā hṛṣṭaḥ karṇam tam abhiṣasvaje

analyzed: abravīt ca punar karṇam stūyamānaḥ sutaḥ tava

analyzed: na ati hṛṣṭa manāḥ hi eṣa madra rājaḥ abhibhāṣate

original: rājan madhurayā vācā punar enaṃ bravīhi vai
analyzed: rājan madhurayā vācā punar enam bravīhi vai
translated: O king, speak to him again with sweet words.

analyzed: tatas rājā mahā prājñaḥ sarva astra kuśalaḥ balī
translated: Then the greatly wise, powerful king, skilled in all weapons,

translated: as if filling the sky with his voice deep like a cloud:

analyzed: śalya karṇaḥ rjunena adya yoddhavyam iti manyate

original: tasya tvaṃ puruṣavyāghra niyaccha turagān yudhi
analyzed: tasya tvam puruṣa vyāghra niyaccha turagān yudhi
translated: O tiger among men, restrain his horses in battle.

original: karṇo hatvetarān sarvān phalgunaṃ hantum icchati
analyzed: karṇaḥ hatvā itarān sarvān phalgunam hantum icchati

original: tathā tvam api pārthaś ca prakhyātāv ātmakarmabhiḥ
analyzed: tathā tvam api pārthaḥ ca prakhyātau ātma karmabhiḥ
translated: Similarly, you and Partha are renowned for your own deeds.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: adhikṣiptaḥ tu rādheyaḥ śalyena amita tejasā
translated: Thus rebuked by Shalya, the infinitely energetic son of Radha,

analyzed: śalyam āha su saṃkruddhaḥ vāc śalyam avadhārayan
translated: remembering the verbal sting, became extremely angry and said to Shalya:

original: guṇān guṇavataḥ śalya guṇavān vetti nāguṇaḥ
analyzed: guṇān guṇavataḥ śalya guṇavān vetti na aguṇaḥ
translated: O Shalya! One who possesses qualities knows the qualities of another who possesses qualities, not one who lacks qualities.

original: tvaṃ tu nityaṃ guṇair hīnaḥ kiṃ jñāsyasy aguṇo guṇān
analyzed: tvam tu nityam guṇaiḥ hīnaḥ kim jñāsyasi aguṇaḥ guṇān
translated: But you, always devoid of qualities, what will you know of qualities?

original: arjunasya mahāstrāṇi krodhaṃ vīryaṃ dhanuḥ śarān
analyzed: arjunasya mahā astrāṇi krodham vīryam dhanuḥ śarān
translated: I know Arjuna's great weapons, his anger, valor, bow and arrows,

original: ahaṃ śalyābhijānāmi na tvaṃ jānāsi tat tathā🔽vikramaṃ ca mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: aham śalya abhijānāmi na tvam jānāsi tat tathā    vikramam ca mahātmanaḥ
translated: but you do not know them in that way, O Shalya.🔽And the valor of that great-souled one,

analyzed: tathā kṛṣṇasya māhātmyam ṛṣabhasya mahīkṣitām
translated: and the greatness of Krishna, the bull among kings,

analyzed: yathā aham śalya jānāmi
translated: as I know it, O Shalya,

original: evam evātmano vīryam ahaṃ vīryaṃ ca pāṇḍave
analyzed: evam eva ātmanaḥ vīryam aham vīryam ca pāṇḍave
translated: knowing my own valor and that of the Pandavas,

original: jānann evāhvaye yuddhe śalya nāgniṃ pataṃgavat
analyzed: jānan eva āhvaye yuddhe śalya na agnim pataṃga vat
translated: I challenge him to battle, O Shalya, not like a moth to a flame.

original: asti cāyam iṣuḥ śalya supuṅkho raktabhojanaḥ
analyzed: asti ca ayam iṣuḥ śalya su puṅkhaḥ rakta bhojanaḥ
translated: This arrow of mine, O Shalya, is well-feathered and blood-red,

analyzed: eka tūṇī śayaḥ patrī su dhautaḥ samalaṃkṛtaḥ
translated: kept in a single quiver, with a shaft, well-cleaned and well-adorned,

analyzed: śete candana pūrṇena pūjitaḥ bahulāḥ samāḥ
translated: has lain for many years, worshipped with sandalwood paste,

analyzed: āheyaḥ viṣavān ugraḥ nara aśva dvipa saṃgha hā
translated: to be shot, poisonous, fierce, the destroyer of multitudes of men, horses and elephants.

analyzed: eka vīraḥ mahā raudraḥ tanutra asthi vidāraṇaḥ
translated: The solitary hero, the great fierce one, the one who tears apart flesh, bones and armor,

original: nirbhindyāṃ yena ruṣṭo 'ham api meruṃ mahāgirim
analyzed: nirbhindyām yena ruṣṭaḥ ham api merum mahā girim
translated: By whom, when angry, I would pierce even the great mountain Meru,

original: tam ahaṃ jātu nāsyeyam anyasmin phalgunād ṛte
analyzed: tam aham jātu na asyeyam anyasmin phalgunāt ṛte
translated: I would never shoot that arrow at anyone other than Phalguna,

original: kṛṣṇād vā devakīputrāt satyaṃ cātra śṛṇuṣva me
analyzed: kṛṣṇāt vā devakīputrāt satyam ca atra śṛṇuṣva me
translated: Or Krishna, the son of Devaki. Listen to my truth here.

analyzed: tena aham iṣuṇā śalya vāsudeva dhanaṃjayau
translated: With that arrow, Shalya, I will fight Vasudeva and Dhananjaya,

original: yotsye paramasaṃkruddhas tat karma sadṛśaṃ mama
analyzed: yotsye parama saṃkruddhaḥ tat karma sadṛśam mama
translated: Extremely angry, that deed is worthy of me.

analyzed: sarveṣām vāsudevānām kṛṣṇe lakṣmīḥ pratiṣṭhitā
translated: In all the Vasudevas, Lakshmi is established in Krishna,

analyzed: sarveṣām pāṇḍu putrāṇām jayaḥ pārthe pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: And in all the sons of Pandu, victory is established in Partha.

analyzed: ubhayam tat samāsādya kaḥ tivartitum arhati
translated: Having obtained both of them, who can surpass them?

original: tāv etau puruṣavyāghrau sametau syandane sthitau
analyzed: tau etau puruṣa vyāghrau sametau syandane sthitau
translated: Those two tigers among men, united and seated in the chariot,

original: mām ekam abhisaṃyātau sujātaṃ śalya paśya me
analyzed: mām ekam abhisaṃyātau su jātam śalya paśya me
translated: Are coming against me alone. O Shalya, behold my good birth.

analyzed: pitṛṣvasā mātula jau bhrātarau a parājitau
translated: The two invincible brothers, the son of my father's sister and maternal uncle,

original: maṇī sūtra iva protau draṣṭāsi nihatau mayā
analyzed: maṇī sūtre iva protau draṣṭāsi nihatau mayā
translated: You will see them killed by me, like two gems strung on a thread.

analyzed: arjune gāṇḍivam kṛṣṇe cakram tārkṣya kapidhvajau
translated: In Arjuna, the Gandiva; in Krishna, the discus; and the Garuda and monkey standards,

analyzed: bhīrūṇām trāsa jananau śalya harṣa karau mama
translated: Which generate fear in the timid, bring joy to me, O Shalya.

original: tvaṃ tu duṣprakṛtir mūḍho mahāyuddheṣv akovidaḥ
analyzed: tvam tu duṣprakṛtiḥ mūḍhaḥ mahā yuddheṣu akovidaḥ
translated: But you are of wicked nature, foolish, unskilled in great battles,

analyzed: bhaya avatīrṇaḥ saṃtrāsāt abaddham bahu bhāṣase
translated: Having fled out of fear and terror, you speak much that is incoherent.

original: saṃstauṣi tvaṃ tu kenāpi hetunā tau kudeśaja
analyzed: saṃstauṣi tvam tu kena api hetunā tau ku deśa ja
translated: For some reason, you praise those two born in a bad country.

original: tau hatvā samare hantā tvām addhā sahabāndhavam
analyzed: tau hatvā samare hantā tvām addhā saha bāndhavam
translated: Having killed them in battle, I will certainly kill you along with your relatives.

analyzed: pāpa deśa ja durbuddhe kṣudra kṣatriya pāṃsana
translated: O you born in a sinful country, of wicked mind, O wretch, O you who defile the Kshatriyas,

original: suhṛd bhūtvā ripuḥ kiṃ māṃ kṛṣṇābhyāṃ bhīṣayann asi
analyzed: suhṛd bhūtvā ripuḥ kim mām kṛṣṇābhyām bhīṣayan asi
translated: Having become a friend, why do you frighten me with the two Krishnas?

original: tau vā mamādya hantārau hantāsmi samare sthitau
analyzed: tau vā mama adya hantārau hantāsmi samare sthitau
translated: Or I will kill those two who are going to kill me today, standing in the battle.

original: nāhaṃ bibhemi kṛṣṇābhyāṃ vijānann ātmano balam
analyzed: na aham bibhemi kṛṣṇābhyām vijānan ātmanaḥ balam
translated: Knowing my own strength, I do not fear the two Krishnas.

analyzed: vāsudeva sahasram vā phalgunānām śatāni ca
translated: Even if there are a thousand Vasudevas or a hundred Phalguni's,

original: aham eko haniṣyāmi joṣam āssva kudeśaja
analyzed: aham ekaḥ haniṣyāmi joṣam āssva ku deśa ja
translated: I alone will kill them. Be patient, O you born in a bad country.

original: striyo bālāś ca vṛddhāś ca prāyaḥ krīḍāgatā janāḥ
analyzed: striyaḥ bālāḥ ca vṛddhāḥ ca prāyas krīḍā gatāḥ janāḥ
translated: Women, children, and the aged, mostly people engaged in play,

analyzed: yāḥ gāthāḥ saṃpragāyanti kurvantaḥ dhyayanam yathā
translated: They sing these verses as if they were studying.

original: tā gāthāḥ śṛṇu me śalya madrakeṣu durātmasu
analyzed: tāḥ gāthāḥ śṛṇu me śalya madrakeṣu durātmasu
translated: Listen to those verses from me, O Shalya, about the evil-minded Madrakas,

analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ kathitāḥ pūrvam yathāvat rāja saṃnidhau
translated: As they were formerly told by the Brahmanas in the presence of the king, just as it happened.

original: śrutvā caikamanā mūḍha kṣama vā brūhi vottaram
analyzed: śrutvā ca ekamanāḥ mūḍha kṣama vā brūhi vā uttaram
translated: Having heard, O fool, listen attentively and answer me.

original: mitradhruṅ madrako nityaṃ yo no dveṣṭi sa madrakaḥ
analyzed: mitra druh madrakaḥ nityam yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi sa madrakaḥ
translated: The one who hates us is a Madraka, always treacherous to friends.

analyzed: madrake saṃgatam na asti kṣudra vākye nara adhame
translated: There is no association with a Madraka, with a vile-speaking lowest of men.

analyzed: durātmā madrakaḥ nityam nityam ca anṛtikaḥ nṛjuḥ
translated: The Madraka is always evil-souled, always false and crooked.

original: yāvadantaṃ hi daurātmyaṃ madrakeṣv iti naḥ śrutam🔽pitā mātā ca putraś ca śvaśrūśvaśuramātulāḥ
analyzed: yāvadantam hi daurātmyam madrakeṣu iti naḥ śrutam  pitā mātā ca putraḥ ca śvaśrū śvaśura mātulāḥ
translated: We have heard that the evil nature of the Madrakas extends to the very end.🔽Father, mother, son, mother-in-law, father-in-law, maternal uncle,

original: jāmātā duhitā bhrātā naptā te te ca bāndhavāḥ
analyzed: jāmātā duhitā bhrātā naptā te te ca bāndhavāḥ
translated: son-in-law, daughter, brother, grandson, and other relatives,

analyzed: vayasya abhyāgatāḥ ca anye dāsī dāsam ca saṃgatam
translated: other friends who have come, servants and maids,

original: puṃbhir vimiśrā nāryaś ca jñātājñātāḥ svayecchayā
analyzed: puṃbhiḥ vimiśrāḥ nāryaḥ ca jñāta ajñātāḥ svayā icchayā
translated: women mixed with men, known and unknown, according to their own desire,

analyzed: yeṣām gṛheṣu śiṣṭānām saktu mantha āśinām sadā
translated: in the houses of those virtuous ones who always eat flour and gruel,

original: pītvā sīdhuṃ sagomāṃsaṃ nardanti ca hasanti ca
analyzed: pītvā sīdhum sa go māṃsam nardanti ca hasanti ca
translated: having drunk liquor and beef, they sing and laugh.

original: yāni caivāpy abaddhāni pravartante ca kāmataḥ
analyzed: yāni ca eva api abaddhāni pravartante ca kāmataḥ
translated: And those which are not bound, but occur out of desire,

analyzed: kāma pralāpinaḥ nyonyam teṣu dharmaḥ katham bhavet
translated: how can there be dharma among them, who prattle about desire to each other?

analyzed: madrakeṣu vilupteṣu prakhyāta aśubha karmasu
translated: Among the Madrakas, who are ruined, notorious for their evil deeds,

original: nāpi vairaṃ na sauhārdaṃ madrakeṣu samācaret
analyzed: na api vairam na sauhārdam madrakeṣu samācaret
translated: one should neither have enmity nor friendship with the Madrakas.

original: madrake saṃgataṃ nāsti madrako hi sacāpalaḥ
analyzed: madrake saṃgatam na asti madrakaḥ hi sa cāpalaḥ
translated: There is no association with a Madraka, for a Madraka is always fickle.

original: madrakeṣu ca duḥsparśaṃ śaucaṃ gāndhārakeṣu ca
analyzed: madrakeṣu ca duḥsparśam śaucam gāndhārakeṣu ca
translated: And the touch of Madrakas is impure, as is that of Gandharakas.

analyzed: rāja yājaka yājyena naṣṭam dattam haviḥ bhavet
translated: The sacrificial offering given by one who has a Madraka as his priest is lost.

analyzed: śūdra saṃskārakaḥ vipraḥ yathā yāti parābhavam
translated: Just as a brahmin who performs the sacraments for a Shudra is defeated,

analyzed: tathā brahma dviṣaḥ nityam gacchanti iha parābhavam
translated: so those who always hate the Vedas are defeated in this world.

original: tathaiva saṃgataṃ kṛtvā naraḥ patati madrakaiḥ🔽na tathā saṃgataṃ cāpi madrakeṣv iha vidyate
analyzed: tathā eva saṃgatam kṛtvā naraḥ patati madrakaiḥ  na tathā saṃgatam ca api madrakeṣu iha vidyate
translated: In the same way, a man falls by associating with Madrakas.🔽And there is no association with Madrakas here.

original: madrake saṃgataṃ nāsti hataṃ vṛścikato viṣam
analyzed: madrake saṃgatam na asti hatam vṛścikataḥ viṣam
translated: There is no association with a Madraka, the poison of a scorpion is fatal.

original: ātharvaṇena mantreṇa sarvā śāntiḥ kṛtā bhavet
analyzed: ātharvaṇena mantreṇa sarvā śāntiḥ kṛtā bhavet
translated: All pacification is done by the Atharvan mantra.

analyzed: iti vṛścika daṣṭasya nānā viṣa hatasya ca
translated: Thus for one bitten by a scorpion or afflicted by various poisons,

original: kurvanti bheṣajaṃ prājñāḥ satyaṃ tac cāpi dṛśyate
analyzed: kurvanti bheṣajam prājñāḥ satyam tat ca api dṛśyate
translated: the wise make medicine, and that is also seen to be true.

original: evaṃ vidvañ joṣam āssva śṛṇu cātrottaraṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: evam joṣam āssva śṛṇu ca atra uttaram vacaḥ
translated: Knowing this, be patient and listen to the reply here.

original: vāsāṃsy utsṛjya nṛtyanti striyo yā madyamohitāḥ
analyzed: vāsāṃsi utsṛjya nṛtyanti striyaḥ yāḥ madya mohitāḥ
translated: The women who dance, abandoning their clothes, intoxicated by liquor,

analyzed: mithune saṃyatāḥ ca api yathā kāma carāḥ ca tāḥ
translated: and those who are unrestrained in sexual intercourse, going as they please,

original: tāsāṃ putraḥ kathaṃ dharmaṃ madrako vaktum arhati
analyzed: tāsām putraḥ katham dharmam madrakaḥ vaktum arhati
translated: how can the son of such a woman, a Madraka, deserve to speak about dharma?

analyzed: yāḥ tiṣṭhantyaḥ pramehanti yathā eva uṣṭrī daśerake
translated: Those who stand and urinate like a she-mule in a narrow passage,

analyzed: tāsām vibhraṣṭa lajjānām nirlajjānām tatas tatas
translated: of those who have lost their shame, who are shameless in various ways,

original: tvaṃ putras tādṛśīnāṃ hi dharmaṃ vaktum ihecchasi
analyzed: tvam putraḥ tādṛśīnām hi dharmam vaktum iha icchasi
translated: you are the son, and you wish to speak about dharma here.

analyzed: su vīrakam yācyamānā madrakā kaṣati sphijau
translated: When asked for a Suviraka, the Madra women scratch their buttocks,

analyzed: a dātu kāmā vacanam idam vadati dāruṇam
translated: and unwilling to give, they speak these terrible words:

original: mā mā suvīrakaṃ kaś cid yācatāṃ dayito mama
analyzed: mā mā su vīrakam kaḥ cit yācatām dayitaḥ mama
translated: No one should ask me for my beloved Suviraka.

original: putraṃ dadyāṃ pratipadaṃ na tu dadyāṃ suvīrakam🔽nāryo bṛhatyo nirhrīkā madrakāḥ kambalāvṛtāḥ
analyzed: putram dadyām pratipadam na tu dadyām su vīrakam  nāryaḥ bṛhatyaḥ nirhrīkāḥ madrakāḥ kambala āvṛtāḥ
translated: I would give my son as a pledge, but I would not give a Suviraka.🔽We have heard that the large, shameless Madra women, covered with blankets,

original: ghasmarā naṣṭaśaucāś ca prāya ity anuśuśruma
analyzed: ghasmarāḥ naṣṭa śaucāḥ ca prāyas iti anuśuśruma
translated: are greedy and have lost their purity, for the most part.

analyzed: pramehitvā sphijā bhūmim karṣantyaḥ hīna śodhanāḥ
translated: Having urinated, they scratch the ground with their buttocks, having little shame.

original: spṛṣṭvā vāgbhir na mṛdbhiś ca nityocchiṣṭā bhavanti hi
analyzed: spṛṣṭvā vāgbhiḥ na mṛdbhiḥ ca nitya ucchiṣṭāḥ bhavanti hi
translated: They are always impure, touched by words, not by earth.

original: evamādi mayānyair vā śakyaṃ vaktuṃ bhaved bahu
analyzed: evamādi mayā anyaiḥ vā śakyam vaktum bhavet bahu
translated: Such things and more can be said by me or others, there can be much said,

original: ā keśāgrān nakhāgrāc ca vaktavyeṣu kuvartmasu
analyzed: ā keśa agrāt nakha agrāt ca vaktavyeṣu ku vartmasu
translated: about those who should be spoken of as having a crooked path, from the tips of their hair to the tips of their nails.

original: madrakāḥ sindhusauvīrā dharmaṃ vidyuḥ kathaṃ tv iha
analyzed: madrakāḥ sindhusauvīrāḥ dharmam vidyuḥ katham tu iha
translated: How can the Madrakas, the Sindhus, and the Sauviras know dharma here?

analyzed: pāpa deśa udbhavāḥ mlecchāḥ dharmāṇām a vicakṣaṇāḥ
translated: The barbarians born in sinful countries, unskilled in dharma,

original: eṣa mukhyatamo dharmaḥ kṣatriyasyeti naḥ śrutam🔽yad ājau nihataḥ śete sadbhiḥ samabhipūjitaḥ
analyzed: eṣa mukhyatamaḥ dharmaḥ kṣatriyasya iti naḥ śrutam  yat ājau nihataḥ śete sadbhiḥ samabhipūjitaḥ
translated: We have heard that this is the foremost duty of a kshatriya,🔽That one who is killed in battle lies down worshipped by the virtuous.

original: āyudhānāṃ saṃparāye yan mucyeyam ahaṃ tataḥ
analyzed: āyudhānām saṃparāye yat mucyeyam aham tatas
translated: If I were to escape from the clash of weapons,

original: na me sa prathamaḥ kalpo nidhane svargam icchataḥ
analyzed: na me sa prathamaḥ kalpaḥ nidhane svargam icchataḥ
translated: That is not my first choice, as I desire heaven by dying.

original: so 'haṃ priyaḥ sakhā cāsmi dhārtarāṣṭrasya dhīmataḥ
analyzed: saḥ ham priyaḥ sakhā ca asmi dhārtarāṣṭrasya dhīmataḥ
translated: I am a dear friend of the wise son of Dhritarashtra,

original: tadarthe hi mama prāṇā yac ca me vidyate vasu
analyzed: tad arthe hi mama prāṇāḥ yat ca me vidyate vasu
translated: For his sake are my life and whatever wealth I possess.

original: vyaktaṃ tvam apy upahitaḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ pāpadeśaja
analyzed: vyaktam tvam api upahitaḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ pāpa deśa ja
translated: It is clear that you too are bribed by the Pandavas, born in a sinful country,

original: yathā hy amitravat sarvaṃ tvam asmāsu pravartase
analyzed: yathā hi amitra vat sarvam tvam asmāsu pravartase
translated: For you act towards us as if you were an enemy.

original: kāmaṃ na khalu śakyo 'haṃ tvadvidhānāṃ śatair api
analyzed: kāmam na khalu śakyaḥ ham tvadvidhānām śataiḥ api
translated: I cannot be turned away from battle by even a hundred like you,

original: saṃgrāmād vimukhaḥ kartuṃ dharmajña iva nāstikaiḥ
analyzed: saṃgrāmāt vimukhaḥ kartum dharma jñaḥ iva nāstikaiḥ
translated: Just as one who knows dharma cannot be turned away by atheists.

original: sāraṅga iva gharmārtaḥ kāmaṃ vilapa śuṣya ca
analyzed: sāraṅgaḥ iva gharma ārtaḥ kāmam vilapa śuṣya ca
translated: Like a thirsty deer, lament and dry up as you will,

analyzed: na aham bhīṣayitum śakyaḥ kṣatra vṛtte vyavasthitaḥ
translated: I cannot be frightened, established as I am in the conduct of a kshatriya.

analyzed: tanutyajām nṛsiṃhānām āhaveṣu anivartinām
translated: Of those who cast aside their bodies, lion-like men who do not retreat from battle,

original: yā gatir guruṇā prāṅ me proktā rāmeṇa tāṃ smara
analyzed: yā gatiḥ guruṇā prāk me proktā rāmeṇa tām smara
translated: Remember the course of action that was formerly told to me by my preceptor Rama.

original: sveṣāṃ trāṇārtham udyuktaṃ vadhāya dviṣatām api
analyzed: sveṣām trāṇa artham udyuktam vadhāya dviṣatām api
translated: I am ready to protect my own and to kill the enemies.

original: viddhi mām āsthitaṃ vṛttaṃ paurūravasam uttamam
analyzed: viddhi mām āsthitam vṛttam paurūravasam uttamam
translated: Know that I am following the excellent conduct of Pururava.

original: na tad bhūtaṃ prapaśyāmi triṣu lokeṣu madraka
analyzed: na tat bhūtam prapaśyāmi triṣu lokeṣu madraka
translated: O Madraka, I do not see any being in the three worlds

original: yo mām asmād abhiprāyād vārayed iti me matiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ mām asmāt abhiprāyāt vārayet iti me matiḥ
translated: who, in my opinion, can dissuade me from this resolve.

original: evaṃ vidvañ joṣam āssva trāsāt kiṃ bahu bhāṣase
analyzed: evam vidvam joṣam āssva trāsāt kim bahu bhāṣase
translated: Knowing this, O learned one, be silent. Why do you speak much out of fear?

original: mā tvā hatvā pradāsyāmi kravyādbhyo madrakādhama
analyzed: mā tvā hatvā pradāsyāmi kravyādbhyaḥ madraka adhama
translated: O worst of the Madrakas, I will not kill you and give you to the carnivorous beasts.

analyzed: mitra pratīkṣayā śalya dhārtarāṣṭrasya ca ubhayoḥ
translated: O Shalya, for the sake of friendship and for the sake of both the sons of Dhritarashtra,

analyzed: apavāda titikṣābhiḥ tribhiḥ etaiḥ hi jīvasi
translated: you live by these three: by bearing insults, by forbearance, and by these.

original: punaś ced īdṛśaṃ vākyaṃ madrarāja vadiṣyasi
analyzed: punar ced īdṛśam vākyam madra rāja vadiṣyasi

analyzed: vidūra pātāt toyasya kim punar karṇa vāyasaḥ  atha haṃsaḥ abhyatikramya muhūrtam iti ca iti ca  avekṣamāṇaḥ tam kākam na aśaknot vyapasarpitum

analyzed: atikramya ca cakrāṅgaḥ kākam tam samudaikṣata

analyzed: tam prahasya ca cakrāṅgaḥ kākam manda gatim tadā

analyzed: bahūni patanāni tvam ācakṣāṇaḥ muhur muhur
