analyzed: yudhyamānasya saṃgrāme prāptasya ekāyane bhayam
translated: While fighting in battle, when I reached the point of no return, I was afraid.

analyzed: tasmāt bibhemi balavat brāhmaṇa vyāhṛtāt aham
translated: Therefore, I greatly fear the words spoken by the Brahmana.

analyzed: ete hi soma rājānaḥ īśvarāḥ sukha duḥkhayoḥ
translated: For these kings of the Soma lineage are the lords of happiness and sorrow.

original: adāṃ tasmai gosahasraṃ balīvardāṃś ca ṣaṭśatān
analyzed: adām tasmai go sahasram balīvardān ca ṣaṭśatān
translated: I gave him a thousand cows and six hundred bulls.

original: prasādaṃ na lebhe śalya brāhmaṇān madrakeśvara🔽kadā cid brāhmaṇasyātha homadhenor ahaṃ nṛpa
analyzed: prasādam na lebhe śalya brāhmaṇān madraka īśvara  kadā cit brāhmaṇasya atha homadhenoḥ aham nṛpa
translated: But, Shalya, I did not obtain the favor of the Brahmins, O lord of Madra.🔽Once, O king, I unknowingly shot a terrible and fearful arrow

original: ajānann akṣipaṃ bāṇaṃ ghorarūpaṃ bhayānakam🔽homadhenvā vatsam asya pramatta iṣuṇāhanam
analyzed: ajānan akṣipam bāṇam ghora rūpam bhayānakam  homadhenvāḥ vatsam asya pramattaḥ iṣuṇā ahanam
translated: at the sacrificial cow of a Brahmin, while I was careless.🔽While grazing in the forest, O Shalya, I struck with an arrow the calf of that sacrificial cow,

original: carantam ajane śalya brāhmaṇāt tapaso nidheḥ🔽yasmāt tvayā pramattena homadhenvā hataḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: carantam ajane śalya brāhmaṇāt tapasaḥ nidheḥ  yasmāt tvayā pramattena homadhenvāḥ hataḥ sutaḥ
translated: of a Brahmin who was a treasure of austerities.🔽Since you, while careless, killed the son of the sacrificial cow,

original: yasmād vatsa tvayā cātra homadhenvā hataḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: yasmāt vatsa tvayā ca atra homadhenvāḥ hataḥ sutaḥ
translated: and since you, O son, killed the son of the sacrificial cow here,

original: tasmāt tvam api rādheya vākśalyaṃ mahad āpnuhi
analyzed: tasmāt tvam api rādheya vāc śalyam mahat āpnuhi
translated: therefore, O son of Radha, you will also obtain a great mental dart,

analyzed: śvabhre te patitā cakram
translated: a wheel will fall into your pit,

analyzed: yudhyamānasya śatruṇā
translated: while you are fighting with an enemy,

analyzed: prāpte ekāyane kāle mṛtyu sādhāraṇe tvayi
translated: when you have reached a one-way path, when you are sharing death with it,

analyzed: spardhase yena saṃgrāme yad artham ghaṭase niśam
translated: with whom you are competing in battle, for whose sake you are striving day and night,

original: tata eva dhruvaṃ mṛtyuṃ sūta prāpsyasi saṃyuge
analyzed: tatas eva dhruvam mṛtyum sūta prāpsyasi saṃyuge
translated: from that very place, O charioteer, you will certainly meet death in battle.

analyzed: aham prasādayām cakre brāhmaṇam saṃśita vratam
translated: I tried to please the Brahmin of rigid vows,

original: gavāṃ daśaśataṃ vittaṃ balīvardāṃś ca ṣaṭśatam
analyzed: gavām daśaśatam vittam balīvardān ca ṣaṭśatam
translated: giving him a hundred and ten cows and six hundred bulls.

original: prayacchann ālabhaṃ kāmaṃ brāhmaṇāt tam ahaṃ tadā🔽dāsīśataṃ niṣkakaṇṭhaṃ śatam aśvatarīrathān
analyzed: prayacchan ālabham kāmam brāhmaṇāt tam aham tadā  dāsī śatam niṣka kaṇṭham śatam aśvatarī rathān
translated: I was giving away that object of desire to the brahmin.🔽One hundred female slaves with golden necklaces, one hundred chariots with mules,

analyzed: kanyānām niṣka kaṇṭhīnām sahasram samalaṃkṛtam
translated: One thousand ornamented maidens with golden necklaces,

analyzed: śalyam uddhartum āyāntam
translated: Shalya was coming to remove the stake,

analyzed: īṣā dantān saptaśatān dāsī dāsa śatāni ca
translated: Seven hundred elephants with tusks like plowshares, hundreds of male and female slaves,

analyzed: kuñjarān ṣaṣṭihāyanān
translated: Sixty-year-old elephants,

analyzed: aśvānām ca sahasre dve
translated: And two thousand horses,

original: dadato dvijamukhyāya prasādaṃ na cakāra me
analyzed: dadataḥ dvijamukhyāya prasādam na cakāra me
translated: I gave to the chief of the twice-born, but he did not show me favor.

analyzed: kṛṣṇānām śveta vatsānām sahasrāṇi caturdaśa
translated: Fourteen thousand black cows with white calves,

original: āharan na labhe tasmāt prasādaṃ dvijasattamāt
analyzed: āharan na labhe tasmāt prasādam dvijasattamāt
translated: I brought, but I did not obtain favor from that best of brahmins.

original: ṛddhaṃ gehaṃ sarvakāmair yac ca me vasu kiṃ cana
analyzed: ṛddham geham sarva kāmaiḥ yat ca me vasu kim cana
translated: My prosperous house with all the objects of desire and whatever wealth I have,

original: tat sarvam asmai satkṛtya prayacchāmi na cecchati
analyzed: tat sarvam asmai satkṛtya prayacchāmi na ca icchati
translated: I will respectfully give it all to him, but he does not accept.

original: yat kiṃ cin māmakaṃ vittaṃ tvadadhīnaṃ karomi tat
analyzed: yat kim cit māmakam vittam tvad adhīnam karomi tat
translated: Whatever wealth I have, I make it subject to you.

original: iti māṃ yācamānaṃ vai brāhmaṇaḥ pratyavārayat
analyzed: iti mām yācamānam vai brāhmaṇaḥ pratyavārayat
translated: Thus, when I was begging, the brahmin stopped me,

analyzed: krodha dīpta īkṣaṇaḥ śalya nirdahān iva cakṣuṣā
translated: With eyes blazing with anger, Shalya, as if burning with his eyes.

analyzed: tatas bravīt mām yācantam aparāddham prayatnataḥ
translated: Then he spoke to me, begging with all my efforts, the one who had offended,

original: vyāhṛtaṃ yan mayā sūta tat tathā na tad anyathā
analyzed: vyāhṛtam yat mayā sūta tat tathā na tat anyathā
translated: O Suta, what has been said by me is so, not otherwise.

original: anṛtoktaṃ prajā hanyāt tataḥ pāpam avāpnuyāt
analyzed: anṛta uktam prajāḥ hanyāt tatas pāpam avāpnuyāt
translated: False speech would destroy the subjects, and then one would incur sin.

analyzed: tasmāt dharma abhirakṣā artham na anṛtam vaktum utsahe
translated: Therefore, for the sake of preserving dharma, I do not dare to speak falsely.

original: mā tvaṃ brahmagatiṃ hiṃsyāḥ prāyaścittaṃ kṛtaṃ tvayā
analyzed: mā tvam brahma gatim hiṃsyāḥ prāyaścittam kṛtam tvayā
translated: Do not destroy the course of the Brahmana, the expiation has been performed by you.

analyzed: na etat avyāhṛtam kuryāt sūtaja
translated: O son of a charioteer, even the entire world would not do this which has not been spoken.

original: yan mayoktaṃ saroṣeṇa gaccha sūtaja mā ciram
analyzed: yat mayā uktam sa roṣeṇa gaccha sūtaja mā ciram
translated: What has been said by me in anger, go, son of a charioteer, do not delay.

original: iti mām asakṛt kruddhaḥ sa uvāca dvijottamaḥ
analyzed: iti mām asakṛt kruddhaḥ saḥ uvāca dvijottamaḥ
translated: Thus did that best of Brahmanas repeatedly speak to me in anger.

analyzed: ete hi soma rājānaḥ īśvarāḥ sukha duḥkhayoḥ
translated: These are the kings of Soma, the lords of happiness and sorrow.

original: nāhaṃ bibhemi bībhatsor na śalya madhusūdanāt
analyzed: na aham bibhemi bībhatsoḥ na śalya madhusūdanāt
translated: I do not fear Vibhatsu, nor do I fear Madhusudana, O Shalya.

original: tasmād bibhemy ahaṃ śāpāt tena satyena te śape
analyzed: tasmāt bibhemi aham śāpāt tena satyena te śape
translated: Therefore, I fear the curse, by that truth I swear to you.

analyzed: saha yuddham sametābhyām adyā idam samupasthitam
translated: Today this encounter has come about with those two who have assembled together.

original: yuddhe 'smiñ jīvitaṃ me 'dya śalya saṃśayam āgatam
analyzed: yuddhe smin jīvitam me śalya saṃśayam āgatam
translated: In this battle, my life today has come to a state of doubt, O Shalya.

analyzed: śakraḥ pi amara rāj tābhyām upagamya āhavam saha
translated: Even Shakra, the king of the immortals, if he were to approach those two in battle,

original: saṃśayaṃ paramaṃ gacchet kathaṃ vā manyate bhavān
analyzed: saṃśayam paramam gacchet katham vā manyate bhavān
translated: would reach a state of supreme doubt. How do you think otherwise?

original: madvākyaṃ nānṛtaṃ loke kaś cit kuryāt samāpnuhi
analyzed: mad vākyam na anṛtam loke kaḥ cit kuryāt samāpnuhi
translated: Let no one in the world make my words false. Accept (this challenge).

original: ity etat te mayā proktaṃ kṣiptenāpi suhṛttayā
analyzed: iti etat te mayā proktam kṣiptena api suhṛd tayā
translated: This is what I have told you, even though I have been insulted, out of friendship.

analyzed: jānāmi tvā adhikṣipantam joṣam āssva uttaram śṛṇu
translated: I know you are insulting me. Be patient and listen to my reply.

original: saṃjaya uvāca🔽tataḥ punar mahārāja madrarājam ariṃdamam
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca  tatas punar mahā rāja madra rājam ariṃdamam
translated: Sanjaya said:🔽Then, O great king, Radheya, having restrained his reply,

analyzed: abhyabhāṣata rādheyaḥ saṃnivārya uttaram vacaḥ
translated: again spoke to the king of Madra, that chastiser of enemies:

original: yat tvaṃ nidarśanārthaṃ māṃ śalya jalpitavān asi
analyzed: yat tvam nidarśana artham mām śalya jalpitavān asi
translated: O Shalya, the example you cited to me,

original: nāhaṃ śakyas tvayā vācā vibhīṣayitum āhave
analyzed: na aham śakyaḥ tvayā vācā vibhīṣayitum āhave
translated: I cannot be frightened by your words in battle.

original: yadi māṃ devatāḥ sarvā yodhayeyuḥ savāsavāḥ
analyzed: yadi mām devatāḥ sarvāḥ yodhayeyuḥ sa vāsavāḥ
translated: Even if all the gods, together with Vasava, were to fight against me,

original: nānyasmād api kasmāc cid amitād ātatāyinaḥ🔽tathāpi me bhayaṃ na syāt kim u pārthāt sakeśavāt
analyzed: na anyasmāt api kasmāt cit amitāt ātatāyinaḥ  tathā api me bhayam na syāt kim u pārthāt sa keśavāt
translated: or from any other innumerable assailant,🔽I would still have no fear, what to speak of Partha with Keshava?

original: nāhaṃ bhīṣayituṃ śakyo vāṅmātreṇa kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na aham bhīṣayitum śakyaḥ vāc mātreṇa katham cana
translated: I cannot be frightened in any way by mere words.

original: anyaṃ jānīhi yaḥ śakyas tvayā bhīṣayituṃ raṇe
analyzed: anyam jānīhi yaḥ śakyaḥ tvayā bhīṣayitum raṇe
translated: Know someone else who can be frightened by you in battle.

analyzed: dandahyamānāḥ tīkṣṇena nīcāḥ para yaśaḥ agninā
translated: The low ones, burning with the sharp fire of others' fame,

original: aśaktās tat padaṃ gantuṃ tato nindāṃ pracakrire
analyzed: aśaktāḥ tat padam gantum tatas nindām pracakrire
translated: incapable of attaining that state, then began to slander.

original: nīcasya balam etāvat pāruṣyaṃ yat tvam āttha mām
analyzed: nīcasya balam etāvat pāruṣyam yat tvam āttha mām
translated: This much is the strength of a low person that you are speaking harsh words to me.

analyzed: aśakto smad guṇān prāptum valgase bahu durmate
translated: O evil-minded one, you are incapable of attaining our qualities, yet you boast a lot.

original: na hi karṇaḥ samudbhūto bhayārtham iha māriṣa
analyzed: na hi karṇaḥ samudbhūtaḥ bhaya artham iha māriṣa
translated: O venerable one, Karna was not born here for the sake of fear.

original: vikramārtham ahaṃ jāto yaśorthaṃ ca tathaiva ca
analyzed: vikrama artham aham jātaḥ yaśaḥ ṛtham ca tathā eva ca
translated: I was born for the sake of valor, and for the sake of fame as well.

analyzed: sakhi bhāvena sauhārdāt mitra bhāvena ca eva hi
translated: Out of friendship, affection, and the state of being friends,

original: kāraṇais tribhir etais tvaṃ śalya jīvasi sāṃpratam
analyzed: kāraṇaiḥ tribhiḥ etaiḥ tvam śalya jīvasi sāṃpratam
translated: for these three reasons, O Shalya, you are alive now.

original: rājñaś ca dhārtarāṣṭrasya kāryaṃ sumahad udyatam
analyzed: rājñaḥ ca dhārtarāṣṭrasya kāryam su mahat udyatam
translated: And a very great task has been undertaken by the king Dhritarashtra's son.

original: mayi tac cāhitaṃ śalya tena jīvasi me kṣaṇam
analyzed: mayi tat ca āhitam śalya tena jīvasi me kṣaṇam
translated: That has been accomplished by me, O Shalya, therefore you live for a moment with me.

original: kṛtaś ca samayaḥ pūrvaṃ kṣantavyaṃ vipriyaṃ tava
analyzed: kṛtaḥ ca samayaḥ pūrvam kṣantavyam vipriyam tava
translated: And an agreement was made earlier, that your displeasure should be forgiven.

original: samayaḥ paripālyo me tena jīvasi madraka
analyzed: samayaḥ paripālyaḥ me tena jīvasi madraka
translated: The agreement should be kept by me, therefore you live, O Madraka.

analyzed: ṛte śalya sahasreṇa vijayeyam aham parān
translated: Except for a thousand Shalyas, I can conquer the enemies in battle.

original: mitradrohas tu pāpīyān iti jīvasi sāṃpratam
analyzed: mitra drohaḥ tu pāpīyān iti jīvasi sāṃpratam
translated: But causing harm to a friend is a greater sin, therefore you live now.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: nanu pralāpāḥ karṇaite yān bravīṣi parān prati
analyzed: nanu pralāpāḥ karṇa ete yān bravīṣi parān prati
translated: O Karna, these are mere prattle that you speak against the enemies.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: ṛte karṇasahasreṇa śakyā jetuṃ pare yudhi
analyzed: ṛte karṇa sahasreṇa śakyāḥ jetum pare yudhi
translated: Without a thousand Karna-s, the enemies can be conquered in battle.

original: tathā bruvantaṃ paruṣaṃ karṇo madrādhipaṃ tadā
analyzed: tathā bruvantam paruṣam karṇaḥ madra adhipam tadā
translated: Karna then spoke to the king of the Madras, who was speaking harshly,

analyzed: paruṣam dviguṇam bhūyas provāca apriya darśanam
translated: even more harshly, with twice the harshness, to that unpleasant sight.

original: idaṃ tu me tvam ekāgraḥ śṛṇu madrajanādhipa
analyzed: idam tu me tvam ekāgraḥ śṛṇu madra janādhipa
translated: But listen to this with single-minded attention, O lord of the people of Madra,

analyzed: saṃnidhau dhṛtarāṣṭrasya procyamānam mayā śrutam
translated: what was said in the presence of Dhritarashtra, which I heard being spoken by him.

original: deśāṃś ca vividhāṃś citrān pūrvavṛttāṃś ca pārthivān
analyzed: deśān ca vividhān citrān pūrva vṛttān ca pārthivān
translated: about various countries and the wonderful deeds of past kings,

analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kathayantaḥ sma dhṛtarāṣṭram upāsate
translated: the Brahmanas were attending on Dhritarashtra, telling stories.

original: tatra vṛddhaḥ purāvṛttāḥ kathāḥ kāś cid dvijottamaḥ
analyzed: tatra vṛddhaḥ purāvṛttāḥ kathāḥ kāḥ cit dvijottamaḥ

analyzed: vāhlīka deśam madrān ca kutsayan vākyam abravīt

translated: those who are within the five rivers, with the Sindhu as the sixth,

translated: I have lived among the Bahlikas for a very difficult task,

analyzed: tatas eṣām samācāraḥ saṃvāsāt viditaḥ mama

analyzed: tatra sma rākṣasī gāti sadā kṛṣṇa caturdaśīm

analyzed: kadā vā ghoṣikāḥ gāthāḥ punar gāsyanti śākale  gavyasya tṛptāḥ māṃsasya pītvā gauḍam mahā āsavam

translated: eat many garlic-flavored cakes,🔽 those who do not eat the meat of boar, cock, cow, ass, camel,

analyzed: sa bāla vṛddhāḥ kūrdantaḥ teṣu vṛttam katham bhavet

analyzed: yatra loka īśvaraḥ kṛṣṇaḥ devadevaḥ janārdanaḥ

analyzed: vismṛtaḥ puruṣaiḥ ugraiḥ teṣām dharmaḥ katham bhavet

analyzed: iti śalya vijānīhi hanta bhūyas bravīmi te

analyzed: āraṭṭāḥ nāma vāhlīkāḥ na teṣu āryaḥ dvi aham vaset

analyzed: bahis ca nāma hlīkaḥ ca vipāśāyām piśācakau

analyzed: karkoṭakān vīrakān ca durdharmān ca vivarjayet

analyzed: āraṭṭāḥ nāma te deśāḥ bāhlīkāḥ nāma te janāḥ

analyzed: vedāḥ na teṣām vedyam ca yajñāḥ yajanam eva ca

analyzed: vrātyānām dāśamīyānām annam devāḥ na bhuñjate

analyzed: vasāti sindhusauvīrāḥ iti prāyas vikutsitāḥ

analyzed: ācāram tatra saṃprekṣya prītaḥ śilpinam abravīt

analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ ca bahavaḥ deśāḥ nānā dharma samākulāḥ

analyzed: aṭatā tu sadā deśān nānā dharma samākulān
translated: While wandering through countries filled with various religions,

analyzed: āgacchatā mahā rāja vāhlīkeṣu niśāmitam

analyzed: bhavati ekaḥ kule vipraḥ śiṣṭān ye kāma cāriṇaḥ

analyzed: gāndhārāḥ madrakāḥ ca eva vāhlīkāḥ ke pi acetasaḥ

analyzed: etat mayā śrutam tatra dharma saṃkara kārakam
translated: I heard this there, causing a mixture of religions.

analyzed: kṛtsnām aṭitvā pṛthivīm vāhlīkeṣu viparyayaḥ
translated: Having wandered the entire earth, there is perversion among the Bahlíkas.

original: uta śalya vijānīhi hanta bhūyo bravīmi te
analyzed: uta śalya vijānīhi hanta bhūyas bravīmi te
translated: O Shalya, know this, I will tell you more.

original: yad apy anyo 'bravīd vākyaṃ bāhlīkānāṃ vikutsitam
analyzed: yat api anyaḥ bravīt vākyam vāhlīkānām vikutsitam

analyzed: satī purā hṛtā kā cit āraṭṭā kila dasyubhiḥ

analyzed: adharmataḥ ca upayātā sā tān abhyaśapat tatas

analyzed: tasmāt nāryaḥ bhaviṣyanti bandhakyaḥ vai kuleṣu vaḥ

analyzed: na ca eva asmāt pramokṣyadhvam ghorāt pāpāt nara adhamāḥ

original: tasmāt teṣāṃ bhāgaharā bhāgineyā na sūnavaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt teṣām bhāga harāḥ bhāgineyāḥ na sūnavaḥ

analyzed: kuravaḥ saha pāñcālāḥ śālvāḥ matsyāḥ sa naimiṣāḥ
translated: The Kurus, together with the Panchalas, the Shalvas, the Matsyas, the Naimishas,

analyzed: kosalāḥ kāśayaḥ ṅgāḥ ca kaliṅgāḥ magadhāḥ tathā

analyzed: cedayaḥ ca mahābhāgāḥ dharmam jānanti śāśvatam

original: nānādeśeṣu santaś ca prāyo bāhyā layād ṛte
analyzed: nānā deśeṣu santaḥ ca prāyas bāhyāḥ layāt ṛte

analyzed: ā naimiṣāt cedayaḥ ye viśiṣṭāḥ

analyzed: dharmam purāṇam upajīvanti santaḥ

analyzed: madrān ṛte pañcanadān ca jihmān
translated: Except for the Madrakas and the sinful Panch-nadi people,

analyzed: evam vidvan dharma kathān ca rājan
translated: O king, knowing this, and knowing the stories of dharma,

analyzed: tūṣṇīṃbhūtaḥ jaḍa vat śalya bhūyāḥ
translated: Be silent, Shalya, like a dull person.

original: tvaṃ tasya goptā ca janasya rājā /
analyzed: tvam tasya goptā ca janasya rājā
translated: You are the protector and king of that people,

analyzed: ṣaṣ bhāga hartā śubha duṣkṛtasya

original: atha vā duṣkṛtasya tvaṃ hartā teṣām arakṣitā
analyzed: atha vā duṣkṛtasya tvam hartā teṣām arakṣitā

analyzed: rakṣitā puṇya bhāj rājā prajānām tvam tu apuṇya bhāj
translated: The king who protects gets a share of the merit, but you get a share of the demerit.

analyzed: pūjyamāne purā dharme sarva deśeṣu śāśvate

analyzed: dharmam pāñcanadam dṛṣṭvā dhik iti āha pitāmahaḥ
translated: Seeing the Dharma of the Panchalas, the grandfather said, Shame!

analyzed: vrātyānām dāśamīyānām kṛte pi aśubha karmaṇām
translated: Even for the outcastes, the fishermen, and those of inauspicious deeds,

analyzed: brahmaṇā nindite dharme sa tvam loke kim abravīḥ

analyzed: iti pāñcanadam dharmam avamene pitāmahaḥ

analyzed: svadharma stheṣu varṇeṣu saḥ u pi etam na abhipūjayet
translated: Even he should not honor this among the varnas established in their own Dharma.

original: uta śalya vijānīhi hanta bhūyo bravīmi te
analyzed: uta śalya vijānīhi hanta bhūyas bravīmi te
translated: Moreover, O Shalya, understand this, I tell you again:

analyzed: kalmāṣapādaḥ sarasi nimajjan rākṣasaḥ bravīt
translated: When a demon was sinking in a lake, Kalmashapada said:

analyzed: kṣatriyasya malam bhaikṣam brāhmaṇasya anṛtam malam
translated: Begging is the stain of a kshatriya, untruth is the stain of a brahmin,

original: malaṃ pṛthivyā bāhlīkāḥ strīṇāṃ madrastriyo malam
analyzed: malam pṛthivyāḥ vāhlīkāḥ strīṇām madra striyaḥ malam

original: nimajjamānam uddhṛtya kaś cid rājā niśācaram
analyzed: nimajjamānam uddhṛtya kaḥ cit rājā niśācaram

translated: Protected by his very angry sons, the best among wielders of weapons,

analyzed: sādibhiḥ syandanaiḥ nāgaiḥ adhikam samalaṃkṛtaiḥ
translated: With riders, chariots, and elephants, greatly adorned,

analyzed: pradhāna vadhaḥ eva asya vināśaḥ tam karomi aham

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca

analyzed: arka vaiśvānara prakhyam samucchrita patākinam

analyzed: tam ādyam ratham āsthāya prayātau keśava arjunau

analyzed: dhanaṃjayaḥ mahā rāja dakṣiṇam pakṣam āsthitaḥ

analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ mahā bāhuḥ vāmam pakṣam upāśritaḥ

analyzed: sātyakiḥ draupadeyāḥ ca svayam rājā ca pāṇḍavaḥ

analyzed: sva balena ari sainyam tat pratyavasthāpya pāṇḍavaḥ

analyzed: atha tam ratham āyāntam dṛṣṭvā ati adbhuta darśanam
translated: Then, seeing that chariot approaching, of an extremely wonderful appearance,

analyzed: ete hastavatā muktāḥ ghnanti amitrām śitāḥ śarāḥ

analyzed: tam ced hantāsi rādheya tvam naḥ rājā bhaviṣyasi

analyzed: ratha nemi svanaḥ saṃkhye meghasya iva abhigarjitaḥ
translated: The sound of chariot wheels in battle, like the roaring of clouds,

analyzed: śrūyate vai yathā vyaktam etau kṛṣṇa dhanaṃjayau

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

translated: He is indifferent to his body and life, and is stronger than others.

analyzed: cira kāla abhilaṣitaḥ mama ayam tu manorathaḥ

analyzed: saṃśayaḥ su mahān śalya prāpya bhīmam ariṃdamam

analyzed: nihate bhīmasene tu yadi vā virathīkṛte
translated: If Bhimasena is killed or deprived of his chariot,

analyzed: abhiyāsyati mām pārthaḥ tat me sādhu bhaviṣyati

analyzed: bhīmasenam samāsādya mayā śakyam nivartitum

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiram bhīmam iha atha śaknuyām

analyzed: yamau tathā daṇḍa dharam yama prabham

analyzed: taiḥ eva naḥ sukha karam āhavaḥ stu

translated: Shalya spoke these words to the charioteer's son who was in that state:

analyzed: abhiyāsi mahā bāho bhīmasenam mahā balam

original: nirasya bhīmasenaṃ tu tataḥ prāpsyasi phalgunam

analyzed: hantā aham arjunam saṃkhye mām vā hantā dhanaṃjayaḥ

analyzed: evam uktvā tatas rājan rādheyaḥ rathinām varaḥ

analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ tha saṃkruddhaḥ tava sainyam durāsadam

analyzed: tatas muhūrtāt rāja indra pāṇḍavaḥ karṇam ādravat

analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ mahā bāhuḥ
translated: The mighty-armed Bhimasena

analyzed: mada utkaṭam vane dṛptam ulkābhiḥ iva kuñjaram  tatas sāyaka bhinna aṅgaḥ pāṇḍavaḥ krodha mūrcchitaḥ

analyzed: bhīmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhima said:

original: prāṇātyaye vivāhe ca vaktavyam anṛtaṃ bhavet

analyzed: prāṇa atyaye sarva dhana apahāre
translated: When one's life is in danger, when all one's wealth is taken away,

analyzed: viprasya ca arthe hi anṛtam vadeta
translated: And for the sake of a brahmin, one may speak falsely.

analyzed: pañca anṛtāni āhuḥ a pātakāni
translated: They say these five falsehoods are not sins.

original: tādṛśaṃ paśyate bālo yasya satyam anuṣṭhitam
analyzed: tādṛśam paśyate bālaḥ yasya satyam anuṣṭhitam

analyzed: bhavet satyam avaktavyam na vaktavyam anuṣṭhitam
translated: Truth may become unspeakable, what is practiced may not be speakable.

analyzed: satya anṛte viniścitya tatas bhavati dharma vid
translated: Having determined truth and falsehood, one then becomes one who knows dharma.

analyzed: kim āścaryam kṛta prajñaḥ puruṣaḥ su dāruṇaḥ
translated: What is so wonderful that even a wise man, though very cruel,

translated: may attain great merit, like the crane from killing the blind?

original: kim āścaryaṃ punar mūḍho dharmakāmo 'py apaṇḍitaḥ
analyzed: kim āścaryam punar mūḍhaḥ dharma kāmaḥ pi apaṇḍitaḥ
translated: What is so wonderful that even a foolish one, though desirous of dharma and unlearned,

translated: may attain great sin, like Kauśika from the river?

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

analyzed: ācakṣva bhagavan etat yathā vidyām aham tathā
translated: Tell me, O Lord, so that I may know,

translated: about the crane, the blind one, the rivers, and Kauśika.

analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Kṛṣṇa said:

analyzed: mṛga vyādhaḥ bhavat kaḥ cit balākaḥ nāma bhārata

analyzed: saḥ ca mātā pitarau bibharti anyān ca saṃśritān

analyzed: svadharma nirataḥ nityam satya vāc anasūyakaḥ

original: sa kadā cin mṛgāṃl lipsur nānvavindat prayatnavān
analyzed: sa kadā cit mṛgān lipsuḥ na anvavindat prayatnavān

analyzed: atha apaśyat sa pīta udam śvāpadam ghrāṇa cakṣuṣam

analyzed: apsaraḥ gīta vāditraiḥ nāditam ca manoramam

analyzed: vimānam āgamat svargāt mṛgavyādha ninīṣayā

analyzed: tat bhūtam sarva bhūtānām abhāvāya kila arjuna

original: tapas taptvā varaṃ prāptaṃ kṛtam andhaṃ svayaṃbhuvā
analyzed: tapaḥ taptvā varam prāptam kṛtam andham svayaṃbhuvā

analyzed: tat hatvā sarva bhūtānām abhāva kṛta niścayam

analyzed: tatas balākaḥ svar agāt evam dharmaḥ su durvidaḥ
translated: Then the crane went to heaven. Thus dharma is very difficult to understand.

original: kauśiko 'py abhavad vipras tapasvī na bahuśrutaḥ
analyzed: kauśikaḥ pi abhavat vipraḥ tapasvī na bahu śrutaḥ

original: nadīnāṃ saṃgame grāmād adūre sa kilāvasat
analyzed: nadīnām saṃgame grāmāt adūre sa kila avasat

original: satyaṃ mayā sadā vācyam iti tasyābhavad vratam
analyzed: satyam mayā sadā vācyam iti tasya abhavat vratam

analyzed: satya vādī iti vikhyātaḥ sa tadā āsīt dhanaṃjaya

original: atha dasyubhayāt ke cit tadā tad vanam āviśan

analyzed: dasyavaḥ pi gatāḥ krūrāḥ vyamārganta prayatnataḥ

original: atha kauśikam abhyetya prāhus taṃ satyavādinam
analyzed: atha kauśikam abhyetya prāhuḥ tam satya vādinam

analyzed: katamena pathā yātāḥ bhagavan bahavaḥ janāḥ

original: satyena pṛṣṭaḥ prabrūhi yadi tān vettha śaṃsa naḥ
analyzed: satyena pṛṣṭaḥ prabrūhi yadi tān vettha śaṃsa naḥ

original: sa pṛṣṭaḥ kauśikaḥ satyaṃ vacanaṃ tān uvāca ha
analyzed: sa pṛṣṭaḥ kauśikaḥ satyam vacanam tān uvāca ha

analyzed: bahu vṛkṣa latā gulmam etat vanam upāśritāḥ

original: iti tān khyāpayām āsa sa tebhyaḥ pārtha kauśikaḥ
analyzed: iti tān khyāpayām āsa sa tebhyaḥ pārtha kauśikaḥ

analyzed: a prabhūta śrutaḥ mūḍhaḥ dharmāṇām a vibhāga vid
translated: Not having heard much, being deluded, not knowing the divisions of dharmas,

analyzed: duṣkaram parama jñānam tarkeṇa atra vyavasyati

analyzed: śrutiḥ dharmaḥ iti hi eke vadanti bahavaḥ janāḥ

analyzed: śrutiḥ dhāryā iyam iti eke vadanti bahavaḥ janāḥ

analyzed: na tān pārtha abhyasūyāmi na ca sarvatra śiṣyati

analyzed: smṛtiḥ dhāryā iti tu eke vadanti bahavaḥ janāḥ

analyzed: na tu tān pratyasūyāmi na atra sarvam vidhīyate

analyzed: prabhava arthāya bhūtānām dharma pravacanam kṛtam

analyzed: evaṃvidhā gatiḥ vīra dharmasya atīva durdṛśā

analyzed: vidyā śīla vayaḥ vṛddhān an upāsya an adhītya vā
translated: Without serving and studying with those who are old in learning, character and age,

analyzed: jijñāsate hi vidyānām sādhanāni eva tattva vid

analyzed: vedam brāhmaṇam āsādya puṇya pāpe paraṃtapa
translated: O scorcher of enemies, having approached the Veda and the Brahmana,

analyzed: yat syāt ahiṃsā saṃyuktam sa dharmaḥ iti niścayaḥ

analyzed: ahiṃsā arthāya bhūtānām dharma pravacanam kṛtam

original: dhāraṇād dharmam ity āhur dharmo dhārayati prajāḥ
analyzed: dhāraṇāt dharmam iti āhuḥ dharmaḥ dhārayati prajāḥ

analyzed: ye nyāyena jihīrṣantaḥ janāḥ icchanti karhi cit
translated: If people, desiring to seize by unjust means, at any time

analyzed: sarvadā hi vadet tat tu na anṛtaḥ syāt vicakṣaṇaḥ

analyzed: yathādharmam yathābuddhi mayā pārtha arthitaḥ tava

analyzed: yathā brūyāt mahā prājñaḥ yathā brūyāt mahāmatiḥ

analyzed: yaḥ mām brūyāt kaḥ cana mānuṣeṣu
translated: If anyone were to tell me among men,

translated: who may be superior to you in weapons,

analyzed: hanyām aham keśava tam prasahya

analyzed: bhīmaḥ hanyāt tūbaraka iti ca uktaḥ
translated: If Bhima were to be called a eunuch,

analyzed: tat me rājā proktavān te samakṣam

analyzed: dhanuḥ dehi iti asakṛt vṛṣṇi siṃha

analyzed: tam hatvā ced keśava jīva loke
translated: If I kill him, O Keshava, in the world of the living,

analyzed: sthātā kālam na aham api alpa mātram

analyzed: evam tvam mām kṛṣṇa jānāsi sarvam

analyzed: kālam loke hīna dharmaḥ hi jīvan

analyzed: tasmāt krodhāt pratikṣapeyam dharmaputram

analyzed: dhyātvā nūnam hi enasā ca api

analyzed: yathā jīvet pāṇḍavaḥ ham ca kṛṣṇa

analyzed: evam jñātvā yat hitam me sadā eva
translated: Knowing this, whatever is beneficial for me always,

analyzed: tathā arhasi tvam tu nibodhitum ca

analyzed: vāsudevaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasudeva said:

translated: And a great thought arose: How will this be?🔽Then Achyuta, the slayer of Madhu, the energetic one,

analyzed: saṃcodayati tejasvī madhuhā vānaradhvajam
translated: knowing that Savyasachi was despondent,🔽urged on the one with the monkey on his banner.

analyzed: tatas gāṇḍīvadhanvānam abravīt madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Then Madhusudana spoke to the wielder of Gandiva,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā pārtham tadā āyastam cintā parigatam tadā
translated: seeing Partha then, troubled, overcome with thought.

original: gāṇḍīvadhanvan saṃgrāme ye tvayā dhanuṣā jitāḥ
analyzed: gāṇḍīvadhanvan saṃgrāme ye tvayā dhanuṣā jitāḥ
translated: O wielder of Gandiva, those who have been conquered by you in battle with your bow,

original: na teṣāṃ mānuṣo jetā tvad anya iha vidyate
analyzed: na teṣām mānuṣaḥ jetā tvat anyaḥ iha vidyate
translated: there is no man on earth who can defeat them other than you.

analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ hi bahavaḥ śūrāḥ śakra tulya parākramāḥ
translated: Many heroes have been seen, equal to Shakra in valor,

original: tvāṃ prāpya samare vīraṃ ye gatāḥ paramāṃ gatim
analyzed: tvām prāpya samare vīram ye gatāḥ paramām gatim
translated: who, having attained you in battle, O hero, have gone to the highest state.

original: ko hi droṇaṃ ca bhīṣmaṃ ca bhagadattaṃ ca māriṣa
analyzed: kaḥ hi droṇam ca bhīṣmam ca bhagadattam ca māriṣa
translated: For who, O sire, would have been safe after approaching Drona and Bhishma and Bhagadatta,

analyzed: vinda anuvindau āvantyau kāmbojam ca sudakṣiṇam
translated: and Vinda and Anuvinda of Avanti, and Sudakshina of Kamboja,

analyzed: śrutāyuṣam mahā vīryam acyutāyuṣam eva ca
translated: and the greatly powerful Shrutayusha and Achyutayusha,

original: pratyudgamya bhavet kṣemī yo na syāt tvam iva kṣamī
analyzed: pratyudgamya bhavet kṣemī yaḥ na syāt tvam iva kṣamī
translated: if you had not been forgiving like this?

original: tava hy astrāṇi divyāni lāghavaṃ balam eva ca
analyzed: tava hi astrāṇi divyāni lāghavam balam eva ca
translated: For you have divine weapons, lightness, strength,

original: vedhaḥ pātaś ca lakṣaś ca yogaś caiva tavārjuna
analyzed: vedhaḥ pātaḥ ca lakṣaḥ ca yogaḥ ca eva tava arjuna
translated: aiming, striking, skill, and combination, O Arjuna,

original: asaṃmohaś ca yuddheṣu vijñānasya ca saṃnatiḥ
analyzed: asaṃmohaḥ ca yuddheṣu vijñānasya ca saṃnatiḥ
translated: and lack of confusion in battle, and the submission of knowledge.

analyzed: bhavān deva asurān sarvān hanyāt saha carācarān
translated: You could kill all the gods and demons, along with the moving and unmoving,

original: pṛthivyāṃ hi raṇe pārtha na yoddhā tvatsamaḥ pumān
analyzed: pṛthivyām hi raṇe pārtha na yoddhā tvad samaḥ pumān
translated: for there is no man on earth equal to you in battle, O Partha.

original: na cābhimukhato vācyo bhavān etad vaco mayā
analyzed: na ca abhimukhataḥ vācyaḥ bhavān etat vacaḥ mayā
translated: And I should not speak these words to you face to face,

analyzed: mānitasya mahā darpaḥ bhaviṣyati raṇe rjuna
translated: for if you are honored, your great pride will increase in battle, O Arjuna.

original: avaśyam eva vaktavyam atas tvāṃ prabravīmy aham
analyzed: avaśyam eva vaktavyam atas tvām prabravīmi aham
translated: But it must certainly be said, therefore I am speaking to you.

original: atimānāc ca tenātmā mantavyo vai kathaṃ cana
analyzed: atimānāt ca tena ātmā mantavyaḥ vai katham cana
translated: And your mind should be made up somehow or other because of this excessive pride,

analyzed: jīvamāne raṇe karṇe sūtaputre mahā rathe
translated: while Karna, the son of a suta, the great warrior, is alive in battle.

original: bahunātra kim uktena saṃkṣepāc chṛṇu pāṇḍava
analyzed: bahunā atra kim uktena saṃkṣepāt śṛṇu pāṇḍava
translated: What is the use of speaking much here? Listen in brief, O Pandava.

original: tvatsamaṃ tvadviśiṣṭaṃ vā karṇaṃ manye mahāratham
analyzed: tvad samam tvad viśiṣṭam vā karṇam manye mahā ratham
translated: I consider Karna to be a maharatha equal to or even superior to you.

original: paramaṃ yatnam āsthāya tvayā vadhyo mahāhave🔽na hi karṇaṃ raṇe prāpya śakto hi syāt puraṃdaraḥ
analyzed: paramam yatnam āsthāya tvayā vadhyaḥ mahā āhave  na hi karṇam raṇe prāpya śaktaḥ hi syāt puraṃdaraḥ
translated: With utmost effort, he should be killed by you in a great battle.

analyzed: kṣemī pratyāgamet pārtha tādṛśaḥ sya parākramaḥ
translated: For, having encountered Karna in battle, even Purandara (Indra) would not be able to return safely. Such is his prowess, O Partha.

original: tvāṃ tu prāpya mahāraṅge yatnavān api bhārata
analyzed: tvām tu prāpya mahā raṅge yatnavān api bhārata
translated: But having encountered you in the great arena, O descendant of Bharata, even with effort,

original: nivarteta raṇāt karṇa iti me dhīyate matiḥ
analyzed: nivarteta raṇāt karṇaḥ iti me dhīyate matiḥ
translated: Karna would turn back from the battle - this is my opinion.

original: dhanurgrahā hi ye ke cit kṣatriyā yuddhadurmadāḥ
analyzed: dhanurgrahāḥ hi ye ke cit kṣatriyāḥ yuddha durmadāḥ
translated: Whatever Kshatriyas there are who wield bows and are invincible in battle,

original: ā devāt tvatsamaṃ teṣāṃ na paśyāmi śṛṇomi vā
analyzed: ā devāt tvad samam teṣām na paśyāmi śṛṇomi vā
translated: I do not see or hear of anyone equal to you among them.

original: brahmaṇā ca prajāḥ sṛṣṭā gāṇḍīvaṃ ca mahādbhutam
analyzed: brahmaṇā ca prajāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ gāṇḍīvam ca mahā adbhutam
translated: Brahma created the beings and the greatly wonderful Gandiva,

original: yena tvaṃ yudhyase pārtha tasmān nāsti tvayā samaḥ
analyzed: yena tvam yudhyase pārtha tasmāt na asti tvayā samaḥ
translated: with which you fight, O Partha. Therefore, there is no one equal to you.

original: avaśyaṃ tu mayā vācyaṃ yat pathyaṃ tava pāṇḍava
analyzed: avaśyam tu mayā vācyam yat pathyam tava pāṇḍava
translated: But I must certainly speak what is beneficial for you, O Pandava.

analyzed: mā avamaṃsthāḥ mahā bāho karṇam āhava śobhinam
translated: Do not despise Karna, O mighty-armed one, the ornament of battle.

original: karṇo hi balavān dhṛṣṭaḥ kṛtāstraś ca mahārathaḥ
analyzed: karṇaḥ hi balavān dhṛṣṭaḥ kṛtāstraḥ ca mahā rathaḥ
translated: For Karna is powerful, bold, skilled in weapons, and a great warrior.

original: kṛtī ca citrayodhī ca deśe kāle ca kovidaḥ
analyzed: kṛtī ca citra yodhī ca deśe kāle ca kovidaḥ
translated: He is accomplished, fights in various ways, and is skilled in place and time.

analyzed: tejasā vahni sadṛśaḥ vāyu vega samaḥ jave
translated: In energy, he is like fire; in speed, he is like the wind.

analyzed: antaka pratimaḥ krodhe siṃha saṃhananaḥ balī
translated: He is like Yama in anger, strong and powerful like a lion,

analyzed: ayaḥ ratniḥ mahā bāhuḥ vyūḍha uraskaḥ su durjayaḥ
translated: with arms long as a yoke, broad-chested, difficult to conquer,

original: atimānī ca śūraś ca pravīraḥ priyadarśanaḥ
analyzed: atimānī ca śūraḥ ca pravīraḥ priya darśanaḥ
translated: arrogant, brave, a hero, handsome,

analyzed: sarvaiḥ yodha guṇaiḥ yuktaḥ mitrāṇām abhayaṃkaraḥ
translated: endowed with all the qualities of a warrior, a giver of security to his friends,

analyzed: satatam pāṇḍava dveṣī dhārtarāṣṭra hite rataḥ
translated: always hating the Pandavas, devoted to the welfare of the sons of Dhritarashtra.

original: na bhīṣaye tvāṃ pārthāhaṃ harṣaṃ saṃjanayāmi te
analyzed: na bhīṣaye tvām pārtha aham harṣam saṃjanayāmi te
translated: I do not frighten you, Partha, I generate joy in you.

original: sarvair avadhyo rādheyo devair api savāsavaiḥ
analyzed: sarvaiḥ avadhyaḥ rādheyaḥ devaiḥ api sa vāsavaiḥ
translated: The son of Radha is unslayable by all, even by the gods with Vasava,

original: ṛte tvām iti me buddhis tvam adya jahi sūtajam
analyzed: ṛte tvām iti me buddhiḥ tvam adya jahi sūtajam
translated: except you, that is my understanding. You should kill the son of a suta today.

original: devair api hi saṃyattair bibhradbhir māṃsaśoṇitam
analyzed: devaiḥ api hi saṃyattaiḥ bibhradbhiḥ māṃsa śoṇitam
translated: Even if the gods, bearing flesh and blood, were to unite,

original: aśakyaḥ samare jetuṃ sarvair api yuyutsubhiḥ
analyzed: aśakyaḥ samare jetum sarvaiḥ api yuyutsubhiḥ
translated: he would be incapable of being conquered in battle by all the warriors.

original: devair api hi saṃrabdhaiḥ sarvalokeśvarair api
analyzed: devaiḥ api hi saṃrabdhaiḥ sarva loka īśvaraiḥ api
translated: Even if the gods were to unite, the lords of all the worlds,

original: aśakyaṃ taṃ raṇe manye sarvair api yuyutsubhiḥ
analyzed: aśakyam tam raṇe manye sarvaiḥ api yuyutsubhiḥ
translated: I think he would be incapable of being conquered in battle by all the warriors.

analyzed: durātmānam pāpa matim nṛśaṃsam
translated: The evil-minded, sinful, cruel one,

analyzed: duṣṭa prajñam pāṇḍaveyeṣu nityam
translated: the one of wicked wisdom, always towards the Pandavas,

analyzed: hīna sva artham pāṇḍaveyaiḥ virodhe
translated: deprived of his own interests, in conflict with the Pandavas,

analyzed: hatvā karṇam dhiṣṭhita arthaḥ bhava adya
translated: having killed Karna, be one who has accomplished his purpose today.

analyzed: tam sūtaputram rathinām variṣṭham
translated: That charioteer's son, the best of charioteers,

analyzed: niṣkālikam kāla vaśam naya adya
translated: who is beyond time, lead him to the power of time today.

analyzed: tam sūtaputram rathinām variṣṭham
translated: Having killed that charioteer's son, the best of charioteers,

analyzed: hatvā prītim dharmarāje kuruṣva
translated: bring joy to the Dharma King.

analyzed: jānāmi te pārtha vīryam yathāvat
translated: O Partha, I know your valor as it is,

original: durvāraṇīyaṃ ca surāsuraiś ca🔽sadāvajānāti hi pāṇḍuputrān
analyzed: durvāraṇīyam ca sura asuraiḥ ca  sadā avajānāti hi pāṇḍu putrān
translated: which is unassailable even by the gods and demons.

analyzed: asau darpāt sūtaputraḥ durātmā
translated: That evil-souled son of a charioteer always disrespects the sons of Pandu.🔽Thinking himself a hero, that sinful Suyodhana

original: vīraṃ manyata ātmānaṃ yena pāpaḥ suyodhanaḥ
analyzed: vīram manyate ātmānam yena pāpaḥ suyodhanaḥ
translated: considers himself a hero.

original: tam adya mūlaṃ pāpānāṃ jaya sautiṃ dhanaṃjaya
analyzed: tam adya mūlam pāpānām jaya sautim dhanaṃjaya
translated: O Dhananjaya, kill that son of Suta today, the root of all evils.

analyzed: khaḍga jihvam dhanuḥ āsyam śara daṃṣṭram tarasvinam
translated: With a sword-like tongue, a bow for a mouth, and swift arrows for teeth,

analyzed: dṛptam puruṣa śārdūlam jahi karṇam dhanaṃjaya
translated: that proud tiger among men, Karna, O Dhananjaya, kill him today.

original: ahaṃ tvām anujānāmi vīryeṇa ca balena ca
analyzed: aham tvām anujānāmi vīryeṇa ca balena ca
translated: I give you permission, by my valor and strength,

original: jahi karṇaṃ raṇe śūraṃ mātaṅgam iva kesarī
analyzed: jahi karṇam raṇe śūram mātaṅgam iva kesarī
translated: kill the brave Karna in battle, like a lion kills an elephant.

analyzed: yasya vīryeṇa vīryam te dhārtarāṣṭraḥ vamanyate
translated: By whose valor the son of Dhritarashtra disrespects your valor,

original: tam adya pārtha saṃgrāme karṇaṃ vaikartanaṃ jahi
analyzed: tam adya pārtha saṃgrāme karṇam vaikartanam jahi
translated: O Partha, kill that Karna Vaikartana in battle today.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: tatas punar ameya ātmā keśavaḥ rjunam abravīt
translated: Then again, Keshava, of immeasurable soul, spoke to Arjuna:

analyzed: kṛta saṃkalpam āyastam vadhe karṇasya sarvaśas
translated: Who had made up his mind to kill Karna in every way,

analyzed: adya sapta daśa ahāni vartamānasya bhārata
translated: Seventeen days have passed, O Bharata,

original: vināśasyātighorasya naravāraṇavājinām🔽bhūtvā hi vipulā senā tāvakānāṃ paraiḥ saha
analyzed: vināśasya ati ghorasya nara vāraṇa vājinām  bhūtvā hi vipulā senā tāvakānām paraiḥ saha
translated: Of this extremely terrible destruction of men, elephants and horses.🔽Having been a vast army of yours with the enemy,

original: anyonyaṃ samare prāpya kiṃciccheṣā viśāṃ pate
analyzed: anyonyam samare prāpya kiṃcid śeṣā viśām pate
translated: Having met each other in battle, only a few remain, O lord of the people.

analyzed: bhūtvā hi kauravāḥ pārtha prabhūta gaja vājinaḥ
translated: Having been the Kauravas, O Partha, with many elephants and horses,

original: tvāṃ vai śatruṃ samāsādya vinaṣṭā raṇamūrdhani
analyzed: tvām vai śatrum samāsādya vinaṣṭāḥ raṇa mūrdhani
translated: Having encountered you as an enemy, they have been destroyed on the field of battle.

original: ete ca sarve pāñcālāḥ sṛñjayāś ca sahānvayāḥ
analyzed: ete ca sarve pāñcālāḥ sṛñjayāḥ ca saha anvayāḥ
translated: And all these Panchalas, Srinjayas and their followers,

original: tvāṃ samāsādya durdharṣaṃ pāṇḍavāś ca vyavasthitāḥ🔽pāñcālaiḥ pāṇḍavair matsyaiḥ kārūṣaiś cedikekayaiḥ
analyzed: tvām samāsādya durdharṣam pāṇḍavāḥ ca vyavasthitāḥ  pāñcālaiḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ matsyaiḥ kārūṣaiḥ cedi kekayaiḥ
translated: Having encountered you, the invincible one, the Pandavas have taken their stand.🔽With the Panchalas, Pandavas, Matsyas, Karushas, Chedis, Kaikeyas,

original: māgadhaiḥ pārijātaiś ca dākṣiṇātyaiś ca keralaiḥ
analyzed: māgadhaiḥ pārijātaiḥ ca dākṣiṇātyaiḥ ca keralaiḥ
translated: Magadhas, Pariahs, Southerners and Keralas,

analyzed: tvayā guptaiḥ amitra ghna kṛtaḥ śatru gaṇa kṣayaḥ
translated: Protected by you, O slayer of enemies, the destruction of the hordes of enemies has been accomplished.

original: ko hi śakto raṇe jetuṃ kauravāṃs tāta saṃgatān
analyzed: kaḥ hi śaktaḥ raṇe jetum kauravān tāta saṃgatān
translated: For who is able to defeat the assembled Kauravas in battle, O son,

original: anyatra pāṇḍavān yuddhe tvayā guptān mahārathān
analyzed: anyatra pāṇḍavān yuddhe tvayā guptān mahā rathān
translated: Except for the Pandavas in battle, protected by you, the great warriors?

original: tvaṃ hi śakto raṇe jetuṃ sasurāsuramānuṣān
analyzed: tvam hi śaktaḥ raṇe jetum sa sura asura mānuṣān
translated: For you are able to defeat in battle the gods, asuras and humans,

original: trīṃl lokān samam udyuktān kiṃ punaḥ kauravaṃ balam🔽bhagadattaṃ hi rājānaṃ ko 'nyaḥ śaktas tvayā vinā
analyzed: trīn lokān samam udyuktān kim punar kauravam balam  bhagadattam hi rājānam kaḥ nyaḥ śaktaḥ tvayā vinā
translated: What to speak of the Kaurava army, even the three worlds united together would not be able to defeat you in battle.🔽O tiger among men, who else but you is capable of conquering King Bhagadatta,

analyzed: jetum puruṣa śārdūla yaḥ syāt vāsava upamaḥ
translated: even if he were like Indra himself?

original: tathemāṃ vipulāṃ senāṃ guptāṃ pārtha tvayānagha
analyzed: tathā imām vipulām senām guptām pārtha tvayā anagha
translated: O Partha, O sinless one, this vast army, protected by you,

original: na śekuḥ pārthivāḥ sarve cakṣurbhir abhivīkṣitum
analyzed: na śekuḥ pārthivāḥ sarve cakṣurbhiḥ abhivīkṣitum
translated: was unable to be looked at even with the eyes by all the kings.

original: tathaiva satataṃ pārtha rakṣitābhyāṃ tvayā raṇe
analyzed: tathā eva satatam pārtha rakṣitābhyām tvayā raṇe
translated: In the same way, O Partha, always protected by you in battle,

analyzed: hatvā tu bala niṣpiṣṭau bhīṣma droṇau mahā raṇe
translated: having killed Bhishma and Drona, the two great warriors, in the great battle,

analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumna śikhaṇḍibhyām bhīṣma droṇau nipātitau
translated: Bhishma and Drona were brought down by Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandi.

original: ko hi śakto raṇe pārtha pāñcālānāṃ mahārathau🔽bhīṣmadroṇau yudhā jetuṃ śakratulyaparākramau
analyzed: kaḥ hi śaktaḥ raṇe pārtha pāñcālānām mahā rathau  bhīṣma droṇau yudhā jetum śakra tulya parākramau
translated: O Partha, who is capable of defeating in battle the two great warriors of the Panchalas,🔽Bhishma and Drona, whose prowess is equal to that of Shakra, in battle?

original: ko hi śāṃtanavaṃ saṃkhye droṇaṃ vaikartanaṃ kṛpam
analyzed: kaḥ hi śāṃtanavam saṃkhye droṇam vaikartanam kṛpam
translated: Who can stand against Shantanu's son, Drona, Vikartana's son (Karna), Kripa,

original: drauṇiṃ ca saumadattiṃ ca kṛtavarmāṇam eva ca
analyzed: drauṇim ca saumadattim ca kṛtavarmāṇam eva ca
translated: Drona's son (Ashvatthama), Somadatta's son (Bhurishrava), Kritavarma,

original: saindhavaṃ madrarājaṃ ca rājānaṃ ca suyodhanam
analyzed: saindhavam madra rājam ca rājānam ca suyodhanam
translated: the ruler of the Sindhus (Jayadratha), the king of the Madras (Shalya), and King Suyodhana,

analyzed: vīrān kṛtāstrān samare sarvān eva anuvartinaḥ
translated: all those heroes skilled in weapons, who follow them in battle?

analyzed: akṣauhiṇī patīn ugrān saṃrabdhān yuddha durmadān
translated: The fierce leaders of Akshauhinis, enraged and invincible in battle,

original: tvām ṛte puruṣavyāghra jetuṃ śaktaḥ pumān iha
analyzed: tvām ṛte puruṣa vyāghra jetum śaktaḥ pumān iha
translated: Except for you, O tiger among men, what man is capable of conquering them here?

analyzed: śreṇyaḥ ca bahulāḥ kṣīṇāḥ pradīrṇa aśva ratha dvipāḥ
translated: The numerous and extensive arrays, with their horses, chariots and elephants shattered,

analyzed: nānā janapadāḥ ca ugrāḥ kṣatriyāṇām amarṣiṇām
translated: And the fierce and intolerant Kshatriyas of various countries,

analyzed: govāsa dāsamīyānām vasātīnām ca bhārata
translated: The Govasas, the Dasamis, the Vasatis and the Vasatis, O Bharata,

analyzed: nānā deśa samutthāḥ ca nānā deśa samudbhavāḥ
translated: Originating from various lands and born in various lands,

original: tvāṃ samāsādya bībhatso hatā nāgāś ca saṃyuge
analyzed: tvām samāsādya bībhatso hatāḥ nāgāḥ ca saṃyuge
translated: Having encountered you, O Vibhatsu, the elephants were killed in battle.

analyzed: vrātyānām vāṭadhānānām bhojānām ca api māninām
translated: The Vratyas, the Vatadhanas, the proud Bhojas,

analyzed: udīrṇāḥ ca mahā senāḥ brahma kṣatrasya bhārata
translated: And the great armies of the Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, O Bharata,

original: tvāṃ samāsādya nidhanaṃ gatāḥ sāśvarathadvipāḥ🔽ugrāś ca krūrakarmāṇas tukhārā yavanāḥ khaśāḥ
analyzed: tvām samāsādya nidhanam gatāḥ sa aśva ratha dvipāḥ  ugrāḥ ca krūra karmāṇaḥ tukhārāḥ yavanāḥ khaśāḥ
translated: Having encountered you, perished along with their horses, chariots and elephants.🔽The fierce ones of cruel deeds, the Tukharas, the Yavanas, the Khasas,

analyzed: dārva abhisārāḥ daradāḥ śakāḥ ramaṭha taṅgaṇāḥ
translated: The Darvabhisaras, the Daradas, the Shakas, the Ramathas and the Tanganas,

original: andhrakāś ca pulindāś ca kirātāś cogravikramāḥ
analyzed: andhrakāḥ ca pulindāḥ ca kirātāḥ ca ugra vikramāḥ
translated: The Andhrakas, the Pulindas, and the Kiratas of fierce valor,

analyzed: mlecchāḥ ca pārvatīyāḥ ca sāgara anūpa vāsinaḥ
translated: The Mlecchas, the mountain dwellers, and the inhabitants of the ocean coasts,

analyzed: saṃrambhiṇaḥ yuddha śauṇḍāḥ balinaḥ dṛbdha pāṇayaḥ
translated: Fierce, fond of battle, strong, with firm grasp,

analyzed: ete suyodhanasya arthe saṃrabdhāḥ kurubhiḥ saha

original: na śakyā yudhi nirjetuṃ tvad anyena paraṃtapa
analyzed: na śakyāḥ yudhi nirjetum tvat anyena paraṃtapa
translated: O scorcher of enemies, they cannot be conquered in battle by anyone other than you.

original: dhārtarāṣṭram udagraṃ hi vyūḍhaṃ dṛṣṭvā mahābalam
analyzed: dhārtarāṣṭram udagram hi vyūḍham dṛṣṭvā mahā balam
translated: Seeing the great army of the sons of Dhritarashtra arrayed in battle formation,

original: yasya tvaṃ na bhaves trātā pratīyāt ko nu mānavaḥ
analyzed: yasya tvam na bhaveḥ trātā pratīyāt kaḥ nu mānavaḥ
translated: what man would advance, if you were not their protector?

original: tat sāgaram ivoddhūtaṃ rajasā saṃvṛtaṃ balam
analyzed: tat sāgaram iva uddhūtam rajasā saṃvṛtam balam
translated: That army, which was like an agitated ocean covered with dust,

analyzed: vidārya pāṇḍavaiḥ kruddhaiḥ tvayā guptaiḥ hatam vibho
translated: was shattered by the angry Pandavas, protected by you, O lord.

analyzed: māgadhānām adhipatiḥ jayatsenaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: The lord of the Magadhas, Jayatsena of great strength,

original: adya saptaiva cāhāni hataḥ saṃkhye 'bhimanyunā🔽tato daśa sahasrāṇi gajānāṃ bhīmakarmaṇām
analyzed: adya sapta eva ca ahāni hataḥ saṃkhye bhimanyunā  tatas daśa sahasrāṇi gajānām bhīma karmaṇām
translated: was killed in battle seven days ago by Abhimanyu.

original: jaghāna gadayā bhīmas tasya rājñaḥ paricchadam
analyzed: jaghāna gadayā bhīmaḥ tasya rājñaḥ paricchadam
translated: Then Bhima, with his mace, killed the retinue of that king,🔽ten thousand elephants of terrible deeds,

original: tato 'nye 'pi hatā nāgā rathāś ca śataśo balāt
analyzed: tatas nye hatāḥ nāgāḥ rathāḥ ca śataśas balāt
translated: and also other elephants and hundreds of chariots by force.

original: tad evaṃ samare tāta vartamāne mahābhaye🔽bhīmasenaṃ samāsādya tvāṃ ca pāṇḍava kauravāḥ
analyzed: tat evam samare tāta vartamāne mahā bhaye  bhīmasenam samāsādya tvām ca pāṇḍava kauravāḥ
translated: Thus, O son, in that great and fearful battle,🔽the Kurus, along with their horses, chariots and elephants,

analyzed: sa vāji ratha nāgāḥ ca mṛtyu lokam itas gatāḥ
translated: have gone from here to the world of death, having approached Bhimasena and you, O Pandava.

original: tathā senāmukhe tatra nihate pārtha pāṇḍavaiḥ
analyzed: tathā senā mukhe tatra nihate pārtha pāṇḍavaiḥ
translated: Thus, O Partha, when that army was being killed by the Pandavas there,

original: bhīṣmaḥ prāsṛjad ugrāṇi śaravarṣāṇi māriṣa🔽sa cedikāśipāñcālān karūṣān matsyakekayān
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ prāsṛjat ugrāṇi śara varṣāṇi māriṣa  sa cedi kāśi pāñcālān karūṣān matsya kekayān
translated: Bhishma released fierce showers of arrows, O venerable one,🔽And he, skilled in harsh weapons, covered the Chedis, Kashis, Panchalas, Karushas, Matsyas and Kekayas

analyzed: śaraiḥ pracchādya nidhanam anayat paruṣa astra vid
translated: With arrows and led them to their death.

analyzed: tasya cāpa cyutaiḥ bāṇaiḥ para deha vidāraṇaiḥ
translated: With the arrows shot from his bow, which tore through the bodies of others,

analyzed: hanyāt ratha sahasrāṇi ekena eva tu muṣṭinā
translated: He could have killed thousands of chariots with just one fist.

original: lakṣaṃ naradvipān hatvā sametān sa mahābalān
analyzed: lakṣam nara dvipān hatvā sametān sa mahā balān
translated: Having killed a hundred thousand great and powerful assembled men and elephants,

analyzed: hatvā daśa sahasrāṇi saṃnāham sva śarīrataḥ
translated: Having killed ten thousand, he would have cast off his armor from his body.

analyzed: protsārayati gāṃgeyaḥ iti tasya abhavat vratam
translated: This was his vow, the son of Ganga.

analyzed: nihatya nānā nṛpatīn āyudhāni āhave tyajet
translated: Having killed many kings, he would have cast aside his weapons in battle.

analyzed: tena śūreṇa balinā muktāḥ tu ayutaśas śarāḥ

original: gatyā daśamyā te gatvā jaghnur vājirathadvipān
analyzed: gatyā daśamyā te gatvā jaghnuḥ vāji ratha dvipān
translated: Having gone with the tenth speed, they struck horses, chariots and elephants.

analyzed: hitvā nava gatīḥ duṣṭāḥ sa bāṇān vyāyataḥ mucat

original: dināni daśa bhīṣmeṇa nighnatā tāvakaṃ balam
analyzed: dināni daśa bhīṣmeṇa nighnatā tāvakam balam

original: śūnyāḥ kṛtā rathopasthā hatāś ca gajavājinaḥ
analyzed: śūnyāḥ kṛtāḥ rathopasthāḥ hatāḥ ca gaja vājinaḥ

analyzed: daśame hani saṃprāpte kṛtvā ghoram parākramam
translated: On the tenth day, having displayed terrible valor,

analyzed: darśayitvā ātmanaḥ rūpam rudra upendra samam yudhi
translated: Having shown his form in battle equal to Rudra and Upendra,

analyzed: pāṇḍavānām anīkāni pravigāhya vyaśātayat

analyzed: vinighnan pṛthivīpālān cedi pāñcāla kekayān

analyzed: vyadahat pāṇḍavīm senām nara aśva gaja saṃkulām
translated: He burned the Pandava army filled with men, horses, and elephants.

analyzed: majjantam aplave mandam ujjihīrṣuḥ suyodhanam
translated: Desiring to rescue the foolish Suyodhana who was sinking without a raft,

original: tathā carantaṃ samare tapantam iva bhāskaram
analyzed: tathā carantam samare tapantam iva bhāskaram
translated: Thus he roamed in battle, scorching like the sun,

analyzed: padāti koṭi sāhasrāḥ pravara āyudha pāṇayaḥ
translated: Millions of foot soldiers with the best of weapons in their hands,

original: na śekuḥ sṛñjayā draṣṭuṃ tathaivānye mahīkṣitaḥ
analyzed: na śekuḥ sṛñjayāḥ draṣṭum tathā eva anye mahīkṣitaḥ

original: vicarantaṃ tathā taṃ tu saṃgrāme jitakāśinam
analyzed: vicarantam tathā tam tu saṃgrāme jita kāśinam
translated: Thus he roamed in battle, desiring victory,

analyzed: sarva udyogena sahasā pāṇḍavāḥ samupādravan
translated: The Pandavas suddenly attacked him with all their might.

original: sa tu vidrāvya samare pāṇḍavān sṛñjayān api
analyzed: sa tu vidrāvya samare pāṇḍavān sṛñjayān api
translated: Having routed the Pandavas and the Srinjayas in battle,

original: eka eva raṇe bhīṣma ekavīratvam āgataḥ
analyzed: ekaḥ eva raṇe bhīṣmaḥ eka vīra tvam āgataḥ
translated: Bhishma alone in the battle became the sole hero.

original: taṃ śikhaṇḍī samāsādya tvayā gupto mahāratham
analyzed: tam śikhaṇḍī samāsādya tvayā guptaḥ mahā ratham
translated: Shikhandi, protected by you, approached that great chariot,

analyzed: jaghāna puruṣa vyāghram śaraiḥ saṃnata parvabhiḥ

original: sa eṣa patitaḥ śete śaratalpe pitāmahaḥ
analyzed: saḥ eṣa patitaḥ śete śara talpe pitāmahaḥ
translated: That grandfather now lies fallen, sleeping on a bed of arrows.

analyzed: jayadrathasya samare kṛtvā rakṣām mahā rathaḥ
translated: The great chariot protected Jayadratha in battle,

analyzed: antaka pratimaḥ ca ugrām rātrim yuddhvā adahat prajāḥ
translated: And fought a fierce night like the Destroyer himself, burning the people.

original: adyeti dve dine vīro bhāradvājaḥ pratāpavān
analyzed: adyā iti dve dine vīraḥ bhāradvājaḥ pratāpavān
translated: And today, the hero Bharadvaja's son, powerful for two days,

original: dhṛṣṭadyumnaṃ samāsādya sa gataḥ paramāṃ gatim
analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnam samāsādya sa gataḥ paramām gatim
translated: Having encountered Dhrishtadyumna, has attained the highest state.

original: yadi caiva parān yuddhe sūtaputramukhān rathān
analyzed: yadi ca eva parān yuddhe sūtaputra mukhān rathān
translated: If you had not restrained the enemy chariots led by the son of a suta in battle,

analyzed: na avārayiṣyaḥ saṃgrāme na sma droṇaḥ vyanaṅkṣyata

original: bhavatā tu balaṃ sarvaṃ dhārtarāṣṭrasya vāritam
analyzed: bhavatā tu balam sarvam dhārtarāṣṭrasya vāritam

original: tato droṇo hato yuddhe pārṣatena dhanaṃjaya
analyzed: tatas droṇaḥ hataḥ yuddhe pārṣatena dhanaṃjaya
translated: Therefore, Drona was killed in battle by the son of Prishata, O Dhananjaya.

original: ka ivānyo raṇe kuryāt tvad anyaḥ kṣatriyo yudhi
analyzed: kaḥ iva anyaḥ raṇe kuryāt tvat anyaḥ kṣatriyaḥ yudhi

original: kaś ca śakto raṇe kartuṃ tvad anyaḥ puruṣabruvaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ ca śaktaḥ raṇe kartum tvat anyaḥ puruṣabruvaḥ

analyzed: yādṛśam te kṛtam pārtha jayadratha vadham prati

analyzed: āścaryam sindhurājasya vadham jānanti pārthivāḥ

analyzed: anāścaryam hi tat tvattaḥ tvam hi pārtha mahā rathaḥ

analyzed: tapyamānam asaṃyuktam na bhavet iti me matiḥ

original: seyaṃ pārtha camūr ghorā dhārtarāṣṭrasya saṃyuge
analyzed: sā iyam pārtha camūḥ ghorā dhārtarāṣṭrasya saṃyuge

analyzed: śīrṇa pravara yodhā adya hata vāji nara dvipā

analyzed: hīnā sūrya indu nakṣatraiḥ dyauḥ iva ābhāti bhāratī

original: vidhvastā hi raṇe pārtha seneyaṃ bhīmavikramāt
analyzed: vidhvastā hi raṇe pārtha senā iyam bhīma vikramāt
translated: O Partha, this army has been shattered in battle by the one of terrible prowess,

translated: like the Asura army by Shakra in days of yore through his prowess.

original: teṣāṃ hatāvaśiṣṭās tu pañca santi mahārathāḥ
analyzed: teṣām hata avaśiṣṭāḥ tu pañca santi mahā rathāḥ

analyzed: tān tvam adya nara vyāghra hatvā pañca mahā rathān
translated: you, O tiger among men, having killed those five great warriors today,

analyzed: hata amitraḥ prayaccha urvīm rājñaḥ sa dvīpa pattanām

analyzed: droṇaputram kṛpam śalyam bhojam ādhirathim tathā

analyzed: etān tu vai nara vyāghra hatvā vīrān mahā rathān
translated: but having killed these heroes, those great warriors, O tiger among men,

analyzed: sa ākāśa jala pātālām sa parvata mahā vanām
translated: with the sky, water, the nether world, mountains and great forests,

analyzed: prāpnotu amita vīrya śrīḥ adya pārthaḥ vasuṃdharām

original: etāṃ purā viṣṇur iva hatvā daiteyadānavān
analyzed: etām purā viṣṇuḥ iva hatvā daiteya dānavān
translated: Just as Vishnu, having killed the Daityas and Danavas in the past,

original: prayaccha medinīṃ rājñe śakrāyeva yathā hariḥ
analyzed: prayaccha medinīm rājñe śakrāya iva yathā hariḥ
translated: gave the earth to the king, just as Hari to Shakra,

original: adya modantu pāñcālā nihateṣv ariṣu tvayā
analyzed: adya modantu pāñcālāḥ nihateṣu ariṣu tvayā
translated: let the Panchalas rejoice today when their enemies are killed by you,

analyzed: viṣṇunā nihateṣu eva dānaveyeṣu devatāḥ

original: yadi vā dvipadāṃ śreṣṭha droṇaṃ mānayato gurum
analyzed: yadi vā dvipadām śreṣṭha droṇam mānayataḥ gurum
translated: If, O best of men, you honor Drona, the teacher,

translated: you have compassion for Ashvatthama and Kripa out of respect for the teacher,

analyzed: atyanta upacitān vā tvam mānayan bhrātṛ bāndhavān
translated: or if, honoring your extremely well-cared-for brothers and relatives,

translated: you do not lead Kritavarma to Yama's abode,

original: yuddhvā yāmy adya tau pārtha saṃrabdhāv ātatāyinau
analyzed: yuddhvā yāmi adya tau pārtha saṃrabdhau ātatāyinau
translated: Having fought with those two enraged and violent attackers today, O Partha,

analyzed: bhrātaram mātuḥ āsādya śalyam madra janādhipam
translated: having approached your mother's brother Shalya, the lord of the Madra people,

original: yadi tvam aravindākṣa dayāvān na jighāṃsasi
analyzed: yadi tvam aravinda akṣa dayāvān na jighāṃsasi
translated: if you, O lotus-eyed one, are merciful and do not wish to kill

analyzed: imam pāpa matim kṣudram atyantam pāṇḍavān prati
translated: this extremely wicked and evil-minded one who is extremely hostile towards the Pandavas,

analyzed: karṇam adya nara śreṣṭha jahi āśu niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ

translated: O sinless one, in burning down your mother along with her sons at night,

analyzed: dyūta arthe yat ca yuṣmāsu prāvartata suyodhanaḥ

analyzed: karṇāt hi manyate trāṇam nityam eva suyodhanaḥ
translated: For Suyodhana always considers Karna to be his protector.

original: tato mām api saṃrabdho nigrahītuṃ pracakrame
analyzed: tatas mām api saṃrabdhaḥ nigrahītum pracakrame
translated: Therefore, he became enraged and tried to restrain me.

original: vyanāśeya ca yuṣmāsu acarmitaḥ suyodhanaḥ sic
analyzed: vyanāśeya ca yuṣmāsu acarmitaḥ suyodhanaḥ sic
translated: Suyodhana, without any armor, would have destroyed you all.

analyzed: sthirā buddhiḥ narendrasya dhārtarāṣṭrasya mānada
translated: The resolve of Dhritarashtra's son, O bestower of honor, the lord of men,

original: karṇaḥ pārthān raṇe sarvān vijeṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: karṇaḥ pārthān raṇe sarvān vijeṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Karna will undoubtedly defeat all the Parthas in battle.

analyzed: karṇam āśritya kaunteya dhārtarāṣṭreṇa vigrahaḥ
translated: Relying on Karna, the son of Dhritarashtra,

original: rocito bhavatā sārdhaṃ jānatāpi balaṃ tava
analyzed: rocitaḥ bhavatā sārdham jānatā api balam tava
translated: even though knowing your strength, chose to fight with you.

original: karṇo hi bhāṣate nityam ahaṃ pārthān samāgatān
analyzed: karṇaḥ hi bhāṣate nityam aham pārthān samāgatān
translated: For Karna always says, I will defeat the assembled Parthas

analyzed: vāsudevam sa rājānam vijeṣyāmi mahā raṇe
translated: and Vasudeva along with the king in a great battle.

analyzed: protsāhayan durātmānam dhārtarāṣṭram su durmatiḥ
translated: Encouraging the evil-minded, extremely wicked son of Dhritarashtra,

original: samitau garjate karṇas tam adya jahi bhārata
analyzed: samitau garjate karṇaḥ tam adya jahi bhārata
translated: Karna roars in the assembly. Kill him today, O descendant of Bharata!

analyzed: yat ca yuṣmāsu pāpam vai dhārtarāṣṭraḥ prayuktavān
translated: And whatever evil the son of Dhritarashtra has done to you,

analyzed: sarvatra anṛjuḥ aprājñaḥ karṇam āśritya vai purā
translated: everywhere the crooked and unwise one has relied on Karna in the past.

analyzed: na jātu ādhiratheḥ bhītāḥ pāñcālāḥ syuḥ parāṅmukhāḥ
translated: The Panchālas were never frightened of Ādhiratha's son and turned their backs.

analyzed: teṣām āpatatām śūraḥ pāñcālānām tarasvinām

analyzed: adya dṛṣṭvā mayā karṇam śaraiḥ viśakalīkṛtam

analyzed: purā devāsure yuddhe vṛtram balabhidā yathā
translated: like Vritra by the slayer of Bala in the battle between the gods and asuras,

analyzed: adya ca aham anādhṛṣyam keśava apratimam śaram

analyzed: utsrakṣyāmi iha yaḥ karṇam jīvitāt bhraṃśayiṣyati

analyzed: anṛtam tat kariṣyanti māmakāḥ niśitāḥ śarāḥ

analyzed: āśīviṣāḥ iva kruddhāḥ tasya pāsyanti śoṇitam

translated: Released by me with my hands, iron arrows with the brilliance of lightning,

analyzed: gāṇḍīva sṛṣṭāḥ dāsyanti karṇasya paramām gatim
translated: Discharged from Gandiva, will grant Karna the highest state.

original: adya tapsyati rādheyaḥ pāñcālīṃ yat tadābravīt

analyzed: tathā eva āśvāsayām āsa gāndhārī rāja sattamam
translated: In the same way, Gandhari comforted the best of kings.

original: sa daivaṃ paramaṃ mene bhavitavyaṃ ca tat tathā
analyzed: sa daivam paramam mene bhavitavyam ca tat tathā
translated: He considered it to be the supreme destiny and that it had to happen.

original: tābhyām āśvāsito rājā tūṣṇīm āste viśāṃ pate
analyzed: tābhyām āśvāsitaḥ rājā tūṣṇīm āste viśām pate
translated: Comforted by them, the king remained silent, O lord of the people.

original: evam ākhyāya rājñe ca saṃjayo rājasattama
analyzed: evam ākhyāya rājñe ca saṃjayaḥ rāja sattama
translated: Having thus narrated to the king, O best of kings,

original: jagāma śibiraṃ bhūyo hate karṇe mahātmani
analyzed: jagāma śibiram bhūyas hate karṇe mahātmani
translated: Sañjaya again went to the camp, after the great-souled Karṇa had been slain.

original: sa dṛṣṭvā nihataṃ śalyaṃ rājānaṃ ca suyodhanam
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭvā nihatam śalyam rājānam ca suyodhanam
translated: He saw Shalya killed, and King Suyodhana,

original: yodhāṃś ca subahūn rājan sainikāṃś ca sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: yodhān ca su bahūn rājan sainikān ca sahasraśas
translated: and many warriors, O king, and soldiers by the thousands.

original: tathaiva pāṇḍavīṃ senāṃ nihatāṃ prekṣya saṃjayaḥ
analyzed: tathā eva pāṇḍavīm senām nihatām prekṣya saṃjayaḥ
translated: And likewise seeing the Pandava army slain, Sañjaya,

analyzed: sauptike drauṇinā rājan hata vāji nara dvipān
translated: in the night-attack, O king, by Drona's son, with horses, men and elephants killed,

original: sa hi dṛṣṭvā hatān sarvān samantād yudhi saṃjayaḥ
analyzed: sa hi dṛṣṭvā hatān sarvān samantāt yudhi saṃjayaḥ
translated: he, Sañjaya, seeing all of them killed on all sides in battle,

analyzed: prayātaḥ hastinapuram śoka ārtaḥ bhaya vihvalaḥ
translated: went to Hastināpura, afflicted with grief and overcome with fear.

analyzed: hateṣu punar eteṣu prabhūta gaja vājiṣu
translated: And again, when they had been killed, with many elephants and horses,

analyzed: yodhaiḥ ca eva mahā rāja nānā deśa samudbhavaiḥ
translated: and with warriors, O great king, coming from various countries,

original: kurukṣetraṃ tu tat sarvaṃ śūnyam āsīj jagatpate
analyzed: kurukṣetram tu tat sarvam śūnyam āsīt jagatpate
translated: the entire Kurukshetra became empty, O lord of the world,

original: nihataiḥ pāṇḍaveyaiś ca dhārtarāṣṭraiś ca saṃyuge
analyzed: nihataiḥ pāṇḍaveyaiḥ ca dhārtarāṣṭraiḥ ca saṃyuge
translated: with the slain Pāṇḍavas and Dhārtarāṣṭras in the battle.

analyzed: yathā viṣaya jam vṛttam dhārtarāṣṭrasya saṃjayaḥ
translated: Sañjaya related to the son of Dhṛtarāṣṭra all that had happened,

analyzed: nyavedayata tat sarvam yathāvṛttam yathāvidhi
translated: as it had occurred, in accordance with the rules,

analyzed: śaśaṃsuḥ nihitam karṇam phalgunena mahātmanā
translated: and they reported that Karṇa had been struck down by the great-souled Phālguna.

original: yayatus tatra tau tūrṇaṃ yatrāsīd vīrasaṃkṣayaḥ
analyzed: yayatuḥ tatra tau tūrṇam yatra āsīt vīra saṃkṣayaḥ
translated: They quickly went there, to the place where the destruction of heroes was taking place.

analyzed: pradīpa hastāḥ śataśas samantāt pratyayuḥ narāḥ
translated: Hundreds of men with lamps in their hands followed them on all sides.

original: punaś ca śibiraṃ prāpto bhrātṛbhir bharatarṣabhaḥ
analyzed: punar ca śibiram prāptaḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ bharata ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: And again reaching the camp, the best of the Bharata lineage,

original: yat kṛtvā tu ca kartavyaṃ sukhāsīnaṃ yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: yat kṛtvā tu ca kartavyam sukha āsīnam yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: having done what needed to be done, was seated comfortably, Yudhishthira,
